story:
ABOUT THE CREATION

Blue Dependence

It is my third full evening-length performance here in Montreal. After producing my last creation Fragmented Mind in spring 2016 with great feedback from audiences, I was inspired to pursue my own creative channels. Having danced the last year with  Ballet Jazz, I am inspirited with new ideas and here comes the moment. My dream is coming true. I am back choreographing and presenting full evening show.

This creation is very special for me, mostly because of its main topic, which is addiction. Addiction to blue.

Blue Dependence

We all dance throughout our days, years and entire lives. 
We play, we work, we reach upwards, but we always fall to the level of our habits.
If this dance we call life, was a show, it would be called 
"Blue Dependence". 
And if our heroine had a name, it would be Iris.

Iris named after the Greek goddess, who was the link between the divine and humanity. 
Goddess of the high skies and low rocky ocean, Iris was a messenger of the gods; a flower shifting from blue to violet; a set of eyes between two worlds.

Our pupils dilate when we see something we desire - expanding into our irises like ink dropped into a drink. All the iris can do is support this cycle, holding each pupil under tension; cradling them as they grow and collapse over and over.

Our eyes do this dance and we can see a pattern emerging: a pattern of desire, release and craving... a pattern of addiction, and the iris is witness to it all.

I am telling the story of our human Iris and her struggle with dependence. 
This is her struggle and ours. 
We cannot move forward until we conquer what holds us back. 
In the end, it is ourselves.

Once we realize this, we can awaken our spirit and set it free!

ABOUT THE TEAM

Choreographer, Eva Kolarova

Eva was born in Czech Republic. She studied at the National Dance Conservatory in Prague, then Rudra Béjart Ballet School in Lausanne and the Hoschule für Kunst und Musik in Munich. In 2008, she joined the Ballet de l'Opéra National du Rhin, in France. In spring 2011, she joined Les Grands Ballets Canadiens in Montreal and in June 2016 she joined Les Ballets Jazz de Montréal.

A native of the Czech Republic, a professional dancer, and for several years now, a choreographer living and based in Montreal, I have always felt the need to find my own way, my own “steps”, and to invent my own choreographic language.

I started dancing at the age of 5 and won my first choreographic prize at the age of 13.                    

In pursuit of this dream, I recently decided to leave Les Ballets Jazz de Montréal, and took the risk of becoming a free-lance dancer and choreographer full time. 

My goal is to make and produce my own work and found a dance company here in Montreal.

Assistant of the choreographer, Kyra Jean Green

Dancers, Sara Harton, Eva Kolarova, José Flores, Francois Richard

Concept for Video Projection and photo material, Paolo Santos

Music composer, Charles Bicari

Lighting Designer and Technical Director, Pierre Lavoie

Digital promotion/marketing communications, Ryan MacDowell 

Photo by Sasha Onyshchenko

I am very grateful to collaborate with such a wonderful artists and I believe that together we will bring an amazing performance to the stage.

This is where you come in!

For that dream become a big success, we need your help to meet the cost of producing such a performance.

GOAL OF THIS CAMPAIGN - WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING? 

This campaign is important as it will help us with much needed funding to go towards expenses incurred in producing this show. 

Within the team, our individual expertise and processes are diverse, and we are all bringing  something different to the framework of this performance.  

The expenses of doing so are fairly significant, and we are asking for your help so that we may be able to secure costumes, props, production elements, lighting, projection equipment,promotional materials, as well as the means to pay the crew a fair fee for their efforts in making the show possible. The amount we are asking for is $5000. This is only a small part of the whole cost of this creation, but a very significant part which will help us greatly!

From the bottom of our hearts, we appreciate anything you’re willing to give, and can assure you that all proceeds will go to help make our vision possible.

Also. PLEASE come join us in October 20 and 21, 2017 at Cinquième Salle, Place des Arts in Montréal and check out the fun rewards we are able to offer in exchange for your donations, including tickets to see the show.

For more details check: www.evakolarova.com

Thank you very much for your support!

________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE

Spreading the word is another valuable way you can help.   

Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Email it to your friends! 

__________________________________________

CZECH VERSION 

Vážení přátelé!

Ptáte se, proč tato kampaň – neboli kam peníze jdou?!                                                                  

Stručně - všechny peníze jdou do realizace představení. Vždyť i renomované soubory, bez stálé scény, se neobejdou bez peněz štědrých mecenášů a sponzorů.

Jen Vy nám můžete pomoct vyřešit tento velký problém, když uznáte, že můj projekt a já za to stojíme a to svými mecenášskými a sponzorskými dary.

Podívejte se, co Vám o projektu, o sobě a o spolupracovnících zde předkládám.

Bude-li to ještě málo, podívejte se na můj face-book a na mé webovky (www.evakolarova.com).

A sami pak rozhodněte, zda můj talent, podpořený mými profesními výsledky, si zaslouží dostat šanci udělat významné taneční představení, či ne!

Obracím se na Vás pomocí kampaně webu Indiegogo s prosbou o finanční pomoc při realizaci mého nového celovečerního představení 

                             „Modrá Závislost“ 

( Na kterém tradičně spolupracuji s Actors studiem, mou mateřskou školou. )

Pro ty z Vás, kteří mne neznají:

Jmenuji se Eva Kolářová, jsem Češka, jsem profesionální klasická a moderní tanečnice a miluji tanec. Také již mnoho let současně s tancem, se realizuji jako choreografka.

Co je pro mne tanec?

Zatím jsem nenašla lepší definici tance, než jakou jsem si pro sebe před lety, jako velmi mladá vytvořila.

"Balanc nad propastí naší touhy po dokonalosti a kráse, kde  používáme řeč duše, beze slov... Nemůžeme tančit v minulosti ani v budoucnosti, ale tančíme vždy tady a teď, celým svým já! Neopakovatelně!“

Snad proto, již jako malá, jsem cítila touhu vytvářet své vlastní kroky, svůj vlastní taneční jazyk. A tak se choreografování brzy stalo mou vášní.

O mně:

Po třech letech v souboru Ballet du Rhin, po čtyřech letech v souboru Les Grands Ballets Canadiens, kde jsem tančila jako demi-sólistka, a po roce v souboru  Ballets Jazz de Montréal, kdy jsem tančila v uznávaných, velkých divadlech, skoro po celém světě, jsem se rozhodla riskovat a postavit se na vlastní nohy, abych se mohla naplno věnovat choreografování a založit si svou vlastní taneční společnost.

Ne jen proto, věnuji tomuto představení celý svůj čas a energii.

Celkově jde již o čtvrtou mou celovečerní choreografii a druhou, jejíž premiéra bude ve významném divadle na Place des Arts v Montrealu!

O mém choreografování:

Jako velmi mladá,ještě během mého studia na Taneční konzervatoři v Praze,jsem již realizovala několik svých  prací pro Actors studio v různých divadlech.... Později, při mém zahraničním studiu, jsem vytvořila několik choreografií pro Gala představení TCP ve Stavovském divadle a na Nové scéně Národního divadla a spoluvytvářela celovečerní  představení „Portrét E.K.“ v divadle ABC v Praze.

Dále při svém zahraničním studiu, jsem dostala možnost choreografovat v představení pořádaném školou světoznámého choreografa Maurice Béjarta pod jeho přímým vedením! Později již v angažmá, jsem tvořila zejména pro soubor Ballet du Rhin de Mulhouse, dále pro Conservatoire de Danse de St Louis ve Francii.

Od mého příjezdu do Kanady jsem uvedla několik projektů, které vyvolali zájem v profesionální taneční komunitě v Montreálu.:

  • „Metamorphosis de l’amour“ v Théâtre La Chapelle v Montreálu, složené z mých choreografií.

Výňatky z kritik :

Co mě nejvíce zasáhlo z celého večera byla scéna  "Lidský hlas", zatančená  Evou  Kolarovou samotnou…, která nás vtáhla do víru emocí beze slov a přesto naprosto výmluvných! 
V souhrnu: jde o velmi přitažlivé umělecké dílo, které nás vrací k tématu lásky… ( © Voir,  Robert St-Amour - 12.8.2012). 

  •  „Koloběh“ ,který byl uveden na festivalu Quartiers Danses v roce 2014

„Koloběh“ od  Evy Kolářové …. je zářivou „jedna a plus“ současného moderního tance…       ( © Danscussions.com, 15.9.2014).

… Evu Kolarovou, demisólistku  „Les Grands Ballet“, která se, od uvedení vlastního celovečerního představení v roce 2012, výrazně rýsuje jako nadějný choreografický talent a to jak pro abstraktní, tak i pro narativní choreografie…( © Gazette Montreal, 6.9.2014)  

„Koloběh“ byl také vybrán porotou na 20. výročí dalšího významného festivalu v Montrealu „Vue sur la Relevé“ v dubnu 2015.

  •  „Koloběh–fáze II“ , který byl uveden v rámci projektu „Metamorphosis“ organizovaném Studiem 303 a uvedeným v prosinci 2014. 
  • „Rozpolcené vědomí“, mé poslední celovečerní představení, které mělo svou velmi úspěšnou premiéru v únoru 2016, v Cinquième Salle, Place des Arts. 

„Rozpolcené vědomí“, bylo vizuálně ohromující a emocionálně nabité moderní taneční představení, mladé a nesmírně talentované české choreografky Evy Kolarové, která momentálně tvoří zde v Montreálu... ( @Genevieve PM Roy - Gen's Delights )

Také jsem obdržela řadu prvních cen za choreografii na mezinárodních soutěžích.Jsou to právě pozitivní ohlasy diváků, co mne inspirují při mé další tvorbě.Takže opět přede mnou stojí okamžik s velkým „O“, kdy svou veškerou energii a ambice soustřeďuji na realizaci nového celovečerního představení.

A to 20. a 21.října 2017, ve významném divadle na Place des Arts, v Cinquième Salle v Montreálu.

O představení :

Náš život je jako neustálý vířivý pohyb za světlem. Opakující se tanec oslněného hmyzu ...

Přitahuje nás plamen nebo světlo poznání? Budeme sežehnuti nebo povzneseni?

   Hrajeme si, pracujeme, míříme směrem nahoru, ale většinou vždycky opět klesáme zpět, na úroveň našich zvyků a zlozvyků.

Jestliže tento tanec, který nazýváme životem, by měl být představení, ráda bych ho nazvala : "Modrá Závislost".

A pokud by mělo hrdinku, jmenovala by se Iris. Tragická Iris.

   Na rozdíl od řecké bohyně, která byla krásným, okřídleným božským poslem, duhou přelévajících se barev vysokého nebe a hlubokých oceánů, květinou měnící se z modré na fialovou, párem očí mezi dvěma světy. I když, kdo ví ?...

Naše zorničky se rozšiřují, když vidí něco, co si přejí - rozšiřují se do naší duhovky, jako kapky inkoustu spadlé do nápoje. Jediné co iris, sval naší duhovky může dělat, je podporovat tento cyklus, držet každou zorničku pod napětím; a sledovat jak roste a kolabuje, znovu a znovu.

Naše oči tančí tento tanec denně a když se na to důkladně podíváme, můžeme vypozorovat vznikající vzorec: vzorec touhy, uvolnění a chutě ... vzorec závislosti ! A naše duhovky jsou  svědkem toho všeho...

Já vyprávím příběh o lidské Iris a jejím boji se závislostí.

Tento boj je její, tak jako je i zároveň náš.

Nemůžeme jít kupředu, dokud nepochopíme, co nás drží zpět.

Nakonec jsme to my sami.

Jakmile si to uvědomíme, teprve poté můžeme probudit našeho ducha a osvobodit se!

O týmu:

Mám to štěstí pracovat s výbornými tanečníky (Sara Harton, Francois Richard, Jose Flores a Kyra Jean Green).

S velmi talentovanou režisérkou a fotografkou Nasunou Stuart-Ulin, která bude současně vytvářet veškerý propagační materiál.

A nakonec nesmím zapomenout na našeho hlavního technického ředitele Pierra Lavoie, který již dlouhá léta pracuje s velkými tanečními soubory a díky tomu má mnoho zkušeností.

Na závěr:

A proto částka 5000 $, kterou žádáme, je pro nás obrovskou pomocí a jestliže každý z vás nám přispěje, čím může a my dosáhneme cíle 5000 $ (či ho dokonce překročíme), tak tato suma nakonec pro nás bude znamenat velký rozdíl ve finále.

Všechny příspěvky obdržené prostřednictvím Indiegogo, včetně příspěvků převyšujících stanovenou cílovou částku, půjdou hlavně přímo na platy tanečníků a ostatních spolupracovníků a poté na produkci představení a teprve poté na mé náklady!

Z hloubi srdce vám děkujeme za jakoukoliv částku, pomoc, kterou nám můžete věnovat a my vám za to slibujeme, že vytvoříme co nejlepší taneční představení.  

Vaše finanční dary nám pomůžou s uvedením této určitě přínosné práce na pódium!

______________________________________

Dalším způsobem jak nám velmi můžete pomoct,

je - SDÍLENI  a ŠÍŘENÍ  -naší kampaně !

Přes  Facebook, Twitter. či E-mailem, všem svým přátelům!

Vaše

Eva
story_txt:
ABOUT THE CREATIONBlue DependenceIt is my third full evening-length performance here in Montreal. After producing my last creation Fragmented Mind in spring 2016 with great feedback from audiences, I was inspired to pursue my own creative channels. Having danced the last year with  Ballet Jazz, I am inspirited with new ideas and here comes the moment. My dream is coming true. I am back choreographing and presenting full evening show.This creation is very special for me, mostly because of its main topic, which is addiction. Addiction to blue.Blue DependenceWe all dance throughout our days, years and entire lives. We play, we work, we reach upwards, but we always fall to the level of our habits.If this dance we call life, was a show, it would be called "Blue Dependence". And if our heroine had a name, it would be Iris.Iris named after the Greek goddess, who was the link between the divine and humanity. Goddess of the high skies and low rocky ocean, Iris was a messenger of the gods; a flower shifting from blue to violet; a set of eyes between two worlds.Our pupils dilate when we see something we desire - expanding into our irises like ink dropped into a drink. All the iris can do is support this cycle, holding each pupil under tension; cradling them as they grow and collapse over and over.Our eyes do this dance and we can see a pattern emerging: a pattern of desire, release and craving... a pattern of addiction, and the iris is witness to it all.I am telling the story of our human Iris and her struggle with dependence. This is her struggle and ours. We cannot move forward until we conquer what holds us back. In the end, it is ourselves.Once we realize this, we can awaken our spirit and set it free!ABOUT THE TEAMChoreographer, Eva KolarovaEva was born in Czech Republic. She studied at the National Dance Conservatory in Prague, then Rudra Béjart Ballet School in Lausanne and the Hoschule für Kunst und Musik in Munich. In 2008, she joined the Ballet de l'Opéra National du Rhin, in France. In spring 2011, she joined Les Grands Ballets Canadiens in Montreal and in June 2016 she joined Les Ballets Jazz de Montréal.A native of the Czech Republic, a professional dancer, and for several years now, a choreographer living and based in Montreal, I have always felt the need to find my own way, my own “steps”, and to invent my own choreographic language.I started dancing at the age of 5 and won my first choreographic prize at the age of 13.                    In pursuit of this dream, I recently decided to leave Les Ballets Jazz de Montréal, and took the risk of becoming a free-lance dancer and choreographer full time. My goal is to make and produce my own work and found a dance company here in Montreal.Assistant of the choreographer, Kyra Jean GreenDancers, Sara Harton, Eva Kolarova, José Flores, Francois RichardConcept for Video Projection and photo material, Paolo SantosMusic composer, Charles BicariLighting Designer and Technical Director, Pierre LavoieDigital promotion/marketing communications, Ryan MacDowell Photo by Sasha OnyshchenkoI am very grateful to collaborate with such a wonderful artists and I believe that together we will bring an amazing performance to the stage.This is where you come in!For that dream become a big success, we need your help to meet the cost of producing such a performance.GOAL OF THIS CAMPAIGN - WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING? This campaign is important as it will help us with much needed funding to go towards expenses incurred in producing this show. Within the team, our individual expertise and processes are diverse, and we are all bringing  something different to the framework of this performance.  The expenses of doing so are fairly significant, and we are asking for your help so that we may be able to secure costumes, props, production elements, lighting, projection equipment,promotional materials, as well as the means to pay the crew a fair fee for their efforts in making the show possible. The amount we are asking for is $5000. This is only a small part of the whole cost of this creation, but a very significant part which will help us greatly!From the bottom of our hearts, we appreciate anything you’re willing to give, and can assure you that all proceeds will go to help make our vision possible.Also. PLEASE come join us in October 20 and 21, 2017 at Cinquième Salle, Place des Arts in Montréal and check out the fun rewards we are able to offer in exchange for your donations, including tickets to see the show.For more details check: www.evakolarova.comThank you very much for your support!________________________________________________________________Other Ways You Can HelpSHARESpreading the word is another valuable way you can help.   Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Email it to your friends! __________________________________________CZECH VERSION Vážení přátelé!Ptáte se, proč tato kampaň – neboli kam peníze jdou?!                                                                  Stručně - všechny peníze jdou do realizace představení. Vždyť i renomované soubory, bez stálé scény, se neobejdou bez peněz štědrých mecenášů a sponzorů.Jen Vy nám můžete pomoct vyřešit tento velký problém, když uznáte, že můj projekt a já za to stojíme a to svými mecenášskými a sponzorskými dary.Podívejte se, co Vám o projektu, o sobě a o spolupracovnících zde předkládám.Bude-li to ještě málo, podívejte se na můj face-book a na mé webovky (www.evakolarova.com).A sami pak rozhodněte, zda můj talent, podpořený mými profesními výsledky, si zaslouží dostat šanci udělat významné taneční představení, či ne!Obracím se na Vás pomocí kampaně webu Indiegogo s prosbou o finanční pomoc při realizaci mého nového celovečerního představení                              „Modrá Závislost“ 
( Na kterém tradičně spolupracuji s Actors studiem, mou mateřskou školou. )Pro ty z Vás, kteří mne neznají:Jmenuji se Eva Kolářová, jsem Češka, jsem profesionální klasická a moderní tanečnice a miluji tanec. Také již mnoho let současně s tancem, se realizuji jako choreografka.Co je pro mne tanec?Zatím jsem nenašla lepší definici tance, než jakou jsem si pro sebe před lety, jako velmi mladá vytvořila."Balanc nad propastí naší touhy po dokonalosti a kráse, kde  používáme řeč duše, beze slov... Nemůžeme tančit v minulosti ani v budoucnosti, ale tančíme vždy tady a teď, celým svým já! Neopakovatelně!“Snad proto, již jako malá, jsem cítila touhu vytvářet své vlastní kroky, svůj vlastní taneční jazyk. A tak se choreografování brzy stalo mou vášní.O mně:Po třech letech v souboru Ballet du Rhin, po čtyřech letech v souboru Les Grands Ballets Canadiens, kde jsem tančila jako demi-sólistka, a po roce v souboru  Ballets Jazz de Montréal, kdy jsem tančila v uznávaných, velkých divadlech, skoro po celém světě, jsem se rozhodla riskovat a postavit se na vlastní nohy, abych se mohla naplno věnovat choreografování a založit si svou vlastní taneční společnost.Ne jen proto, věnuji tomuto představení celý svůj čas a energii.Celkově jde již o čtvrtou mou celovečerní choreografii a druhou, jejíž premiéra bude ve významném divadle na Place des Arts v Montrealu!O mém choreografování:Jako velmi mladá,ještě během mého studia na Taneční konzervatoři v Praze,jsem již realizovala několik svých  prací pro Actors studio v různých divadlech.... Později, při mém zahraničním studiu, jsem vytvořila několik choreografií pro Gala představení TCP ve Stavovském divadle a na Nové scéně Národního divadla a spoluvytvářela celovečerní  představení „Portrét E.K.“ v divadle ABC v Praze.Dále při svém zahraničním studiu, jsem dostala možnost choreografovat v představení pořádaném školou světoznámého choreografa Maurice Béjarta pod jeho přímým vedením! Později již v angažmá, jsem tvořila zejména pro soubor Ballet du Rhin de Mulhouse, dále pro Conservatoire de Danse de St Louis ve Francii.Od mého příjezdu do Kanady jsem uvedla několik projektů, které vyvolali zájem v profesionální taneční komunitě v Montreálu.:„Metamorphosis de l’amour“ v Théâtre La Chapelle v Montreálu, složené z mých choreografií.Výňatky z kritik :Co mě nejvíce zasáhlo z celého večera byla scéna  "Lidský hlas", zatančená  Evou  Kolarovou samotnou…, která nás vtáhla do víru emocí beze slov a přesto naprosto výmluvných! V souhrnu: jde o velmi přitažlivé umělecké dílo, které nás vrací k tématu lásky… ( © Voir,  Robert St-Amour - 12.8.2012).  „Koloběh“ ,který byl uveden na festivalu Quartiers Danses v roce 2014„Koloběh“ od  Evy Kolářové …. je zářivou „jedna a plus“ současného moderního tance…       ( © Danscussions.com, 15.9.2014).… Evu Kolarovou, demisólistku  „Les Grands Ballet“, která se, od uvedení vlastního celovečerního představení v roce 2012, výrazně rýsuje jako nadějný choreografický talent a to jak pro abstraktní, tak i pro narativní choreografie…( © Gazette Montreal, 6.9.2014)  „Koloběh“ byl také vybrán porotou na 20. výročí dalšího významného festivalu v Montrealu „Vue sur la Relevé“ v dubnu 2015.
 „Koloběh–fáze II“ , který byl uveden v rámci projektu „Metamorphosis“ organizovaném Studiem 303 a uvedeným v prosinci 2014. 
„Rozpolcené vědomí“, mé poslední celovečerní představení, které mělo svou velmi úspěšnou premiéru v únoru 2016, v Cinquième Salle, Place des Arts. 
„Rozpolcené vědomí“, bylo vizuálně ohromující a emocionálně nabité moderní taneční představení, mladé a nesmírně talentované české choreografky Evy Kolarové, která momentálně tvoří zde v Montreálu... ( @Genevieve PM Roy - Gen's Delights )Také jsem obdržela řadu prvních cen za choreografii na mezinárodních soutěžích.Jsou to právě pozitivní ohlasy diváků, co mne inspirují při mé další tvorbě.Takže opět přede mnou stojí okamžik s velkým „O“, kdy svou veškerou energii a ambice soustřeďuji na realizaci nového celovečerního představení.A to 20. a 21.října 2017, ve významném divadle na Place des Arts, v Cinquième Salle v Montreálu.O představení :Náš život je jako neustálý vířivý pohyb za světlem. Opakující se tanec oslněného hmyzu ...Přitahuje nás plamen nebo světlo poznání? Budeme sežehnuti nebo povzneseni?   Hrajeme si, pracujeme, míříme směrem nahoru, ale většinou vždycky opět klesáme zpět, na úroveň našich zvyků a zlozvyků.Jestliže tento tanec, který nazýváme životem, by měl být představení, ráda bych ho nazvala : "Modrá Závislost".A pokud by mělo hrdinku, jmenovala by se Iris. Tragická Iris.   Na rozdíl od řecké bohyně, která byla krásným, okřídleným božským poslem, duhou přelévajících se barev vysokého nebe a hlubokých oceánů, květinou měnící se z modré na fialovou, párem očí mezi dvěma světy. I když, kdo ví ?...Naše zorničky se rozšiřují, když vidí něco, co si přejí - rozšiřují se do naší duhovky, jako kapky inkoustu spadlé do nápoje. Jediné co iris, sval naší duhovky může dělat, je podporovat tento cyklus, držet každou zorničku pod napětím; a sledovat jak roste a kolabuje, znovu a znovu.Naše oči tančí tento tanec denně a když se na to důkladně podíváme, můžeme vypozorovat vznikající vzorec: vzorec touhy, uvolnění a chutě ... vzorec závislosti ! A naše duhovky jsou  svědkem toho všeho...Já vyprávím příběh o lidské Iris a jejím boji se závislostí.Tento boj je její, tak jako je i zároveň náš.Nemůžeme jít kupředu, dokud nepochopíme, co nás drží zpět.Nakonec jsme to my sami.Jakmile si to uvědomíme, teprve poté můžeme probudit našeho ducha a osvobodit se!O týmu:Mám to štěstí pracovat s výbornými tanečníky (Sara Harton, Francois Richard, Jose Flores a Kyra Jean Green).S velmi talentovanou režisérkou a fotografkou Nasunou Stuart-Ulin, která bude současně vytvářet veškerý propagační materiál.A nakonec nesmím zapomenout na našeho hlavního technického ředitele Pierra Lavoie, který již dlouhá léta pracuje s velkými tanečními soubory a díky tomu má mnoho zkušeností.Na závěr:A proto částka 5000 $, kterou žádáme, je pro nás obrovskou pomocí a jestliže každý z vás nám přispěje, čím může a my dosáhneme cíle 5000 $ (či ho dokonce překročíme), tak tato suma nakonec pro nás bude znamenat velký rozdíl ve finále.Všechny příspěvky obdržené prostřednictvím Indiegogo, včetně příspěvků převyšujících stanovenou cílovou částku, půjdou hlavně přímo na platy tanečníků a ostatních spolupracovníků a poté na produkci představení a teprve poté na mé náklady!Z hloubi srdce vám děkujeme za jakoukoliv částku, pomoc, kterou nám můžete věnovat a my vám za to slibujeme, že vytvoříme co nejlepší taneční představení.  Vaše finanční dary nám pomůžou s uvedením této určitě přínosné práce na pódium!______________________________________Dalším způsobem jak nám velmi můžete pomoct,je - SDÍLENI  a ŠÍŘENÍ  -naší kampaně !Přes  Facebook, Twitter. či E-mailem, všem svým přátelům!VašeEva

story:
People need to know that Hattie McDaniel was more than just a Mammy. Off stage Hattie McDaniel was a part of the sisterhood of Sigma Gamma Rho and started the Sigma Sigma chapter in Los Angles, California. She was also an activist, while living in California and fought and won against the 'Restrictive Covenant' laws that restricted Black, Chinese and Jewish Americans from owning homes.

In the mist of her career Hattie took two years off from performing to care for her aging mother and father as well her baby nephew, Edgar Jr. When she returned to the stage, Hattie in 1939, won an academy award for her role as Mammy in 'Gone With The Wind'.  With all of her hard work and dedication to film, family and various communities, Hattie McDaniel later passed away from breast cancer on October 26, 1952. Her story is rarely known and this musical is a voice that speaks to her legacy.

Vickilyn Reynolds, wrote the musical play and performs as Hattie McDaniel in  Hattie..."What I Need You to Know!". She takes the audience on a dramatic musical journey about Hattie McDaniel's  life. The story begins with her early childhood and travels through her relationship with her family.  Vickilyn channels Hattie's difficult decision to leave and move to Los Angeles to pursue her artistic dreams during a time filled with racism and segregation. Through this journey, we see the intimate and personal side of Hattie's life, as a wife, businesswoman, struggling African American actress, and her rise to become an African American Hollywood star.

Hattie..."What I Need You to Know!"

Directed by: Byron Nora

Written by: Vickilyn Reynolds

Music & Lyrics by: Vickilyn Reynolds

Stage Manager: Alyssa Champos

Costumes by: Kevin Mayes   

Costumer: Mylette Nora

Wigs by: Sheila Dorn

story:
5th Element Center for Dance’s mission is to foster personal & artistic development through the hip hop arts for youth to grow into compassionate, knowledgeable, and expressive artists who are connected to themselves & their communities. Through a multifaceted and culturally responsive approach, we work to remove social and economic hurdles that limit access to dance, wellness, and academic opportunities for youth in Aurora, CO.

We work to make spaces that prioritize equity in a field that is permeated with inequities and reflects greater systems of oppression in our society. We believe that the commercialization of dance should not make it inaccessible to the communities who founded many of the most commodified styles out of hardship, liberation, and joy. We are committed to changing the cultures and systems that keep the field of dance homogeneous. 5th Element Center of Dance seeks to build and contribute to a society in which the waves of culture and the arts uplift the expression of the most historically silenced people.

Through dance instruction, self engagement, community engagement, and social emotional & relational and academic supports, we offer resources that low-income and Black and Brown students need to thrive as competitive dancers, as cultural producers, and as humans successfully navigating their own wellness. We have offered tens of virtual dance classes for students of all ages and skill levels, with no cost barrier, and we’re just getting started! Every class and service is a chance for us to provide connection and expression, as an opportunity to enrich our students’ lives.

Your financial contribution will help us lay a foundation for our new organization. It will allow us to open a physical location for our students and programs and hire and train a full staff, including the dance instructors, tutors, and Dean of Students who will be critical to our support systems.

We offer a variety of dance classes. Our central focus is the hip hop arts & culture, and we provide a breadth of classes in many styles, with a majority of our classes being in styles within the hip hop genre.

Reaching our goal of $75,000 will allow us to provide not only dance classes, but our engagement classes as well. Our two engagement classes, Social Emotional and Relational Wellness (Self-Engaged Learning) and Hip Hop History & Culture (Community-Engaged Learning), will equip our students with the history, culture, awareness, exploration, and mastery of hip hop, their communities, and themselves that will guide them far beyond our walls.

Your financial contribution will support the start up of our organization and programs to pursue knowledge, reflection, expression, connection, and growth. You’re investing in Black and Brown leadership, students, and dance teachers and transformation of community and systems through hip hop.

Make a contribution to 5th Element Center for Dance and engage with small businesses and other Black and Brown led businesses. If you want all of your donation to go to 5th Element Center for Dance or if you want to give a custom amount, you can scroll up and press the pink "back it" button. Otherwise, you can participate in the campaign perks system.

Help us spread the word:

  • Repost our campaign on social media and tell us what excites you about 5th Element Center for Dance. Don’t forget to tag us @dance5e !
  • Talk about the project with your friends, colleagues, family, and community!

If you want all of your donation to go to 5th Element Center for Dance or if you want to give a custom amount, you can scroll up and press the pink "back it" button. Otherwise, you can participate in the campaign perks system.Help us spread the word:
Repost our campaign on social media and tell us what excites you about 5th Element Center for Dance. Don’t forget to tag us @dance5e !
Talk about the project with your friends, colleagues, family, and community!

story:
OUR BEGINNING...

Hello! My name is Scarlett Kim, the creator and director of THE END, THE END, THE END... Let me tell you how it all began, and how ecstatic and grateful we are to show our work on the Edinburgh stage!

In 2016, artists from South Korea, the Philippines, China, Puerto Rico, Chile, Alabama, Illinois, New Haven, and Georgia, MFA students at the California Institute of the Arts School of Theatre asked a question that none could answer but no one was exempt from: What is America? We proposed: perhaps it is a rehearsal room, like this one. Tyler mentioned his utopic childhood memory of watching Home Alone with his family on Christmas Eve in his Chicago living room. I said, well, I’ve never actually watched Home Alone, but when I first moved to America, I used to tell people a made-up memory of watching Home Alone with my family in front of a fireplace because it seemed like such an iconic American memory. I believed that to possess that memory would surely make me American.

Then and there we grasped “Americans” and “non-Americans” in the room alike had been developing a practice of imagining and remembering as a way to survive America. Since then, our tribe of outsiders-in-a-land-of-outsiders grew to include artists from Taiwan, Nigeria, Delaware, Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, and California. We often toss around “I wouldn’t give a f*** about theatre if I didn’t have to perform every day in real life.” THE END, THE END, THE END… is a Rube Goldberg machine whose parts are our bodies, convictions, and prejudices, a culmination of our two-year experiment in performing as becoming in America.

 

WHAT IS IT?

Facing end-of-the-world paranoia in America and drowning in media, the exiles labor through the act of remembering and performing. To survive America, they must constantly revise their personal histories and ideologies as the alleged “other.” To combat entropy, to find home, to discover utopia, to believe in anything at all, the ensemble grotesquely reenacts found and real childhood memories, and channels political superpowers.

The blood-pumping rhythm of pop iconography intersects with intensely intimate storytelling, and cuts to operatic manifestos of political prophets, creating an explosive performance collage that defies borders, genre and time. A rich array of multimedia platforms headed by motion-sensor video and real-time light art partners the athleticism and sensuality of the performing bodies.

THE END, THE END, THE END… responds to the urgent identity crisis America is currently undergoing. Through their powerful polyphonic togetherness, the tribe of outsiders-in-a-land-of-outsiders debunks myths of otherness, and invites the audience to co-author the utopia machine.

 

THE COMPANY & OUR PRACTICE

Our body of work is an act of survival and love, a laboratory of being, becoming and performing. We stage our funeral, wedding, birth at once in face of end-of-the-world paranoia. A simultaneous act of rehearsal and archiving, our ontologies and ideologies perpetually re-collage themselves in our ritual, as they do in our lives as exiles. Our mission of polyphony, paradox and porousness manifests formally and through our commitment to changing the world. Our practice is a platform for inquiry into our direct experience with urgent justice initiatives such as institutional oppression, censorship, immigration, post-/colonialism, and gender and racial emancipation. Growing out of grassroots and DIY origins, we conceive of our practice as labor, and urge the audience to work with us. We cast YOU as co-authors in our work as a nexus for exchange of subjectivity.

 

OUR STAKES

THE END, THE END, THE END… has developed through a unique intersection of international artists gathered in America. Our daring take on myths of America and otherness may conflict with freedom of speech measures of some of the countries we are from. In certain cases, some combination of the perceived propaganda message and indirect speech in our work may be subject to censorship. We internationally premiere THE END… at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival 2017, a third space to the dichotomy of our home and our present in America.

By helping us get to Edinburgh, you foster our budding ensemble of two years in search of unique situations for our work that resonates with our liminality and survival stakes. You are our first producers of a collaboration we hope to grow into a lifelong ensemble and practice. We hope to continue to find contexts all over the globe and across genres to produce our work, and we can only do it if you journey with us!

 

THE COSTS

  • Custom fabricated lights, ultrasonic motion-triggered video sensors and toy synthesizers are just some of our exciting technology that our designers are developing!
  • Since we are scattered around the world, we’ve incurred some hefty travel costs, immigration and visa-related costs in order to rehearse together and to travel. Help us make this practice accessible to artists from all corners of the globe!
  • Our company members have been extremely generous with their time and dedication to this work so far. We’d like to support the daily survival costs of our company members while in Edinburgh to meet immense personal investment everyone has made.
  • Our team is hosting the only queer artists' meet-up at the Fringe, and aim to make it a dynamic gathering for queer artists from around the world that lasts beyond our stay this summer!
  • ...and so much more!
 

MORE INFO?

Follow us on @theendritual (Instagram, Twitter & Facebook) + visit our website theendtheendtheend.com + email us at theendtheendtheendedfringe@gmail.com to reach us, and check out our other content including a more detailed look into our practice, synopsis of the performance, images and videos, artist bios, and so much more!

 

A BIG THANK YOU from all of us - Scarlett Kim, Changting Lu, Toritseju Danner, B Ehst, Gabriel Eduardo Jimenez, Jinglin Liao, Tyler Riggin, Henita Telo, Carolina Ignacia Vargas Romero, Dylan Phillips, Josephine Wang, Alex Grover, Chardonnay Tobar, Shih-lien Eugene Yen, Sam Sewell, and Sam Brounstein. ❤️

story:
Short Summary

This summer we are producing a workshop of an original musical at Musicalfare in Buffalo, NY. 

  •  In 2013 I submitted my thesis proposal to create a piece inspired by the life and work of legendary comedienne, Imogene Coca. My name is Marisa Guida and I have been working on that script and lyrics ever since. 
  • It is a family friendly, comedy, suitable for all ages. A coming of age story about a little girl who isn't very popular but learns to accept and love who she is through the inspiration of Imogene Coca.
  • I am on the third draft of the script and we have done three readings with full casts! The next step on the long journey to create a musical is to incorporate music and get it on its feet so we can see what we have and what we need.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Thankfully a good chunk of our expenses have been cut in half because the artistic director of Musicalfare, Randy Kramer, has welcomed us to use the space at no charge.
  • We are raising $3000 to cover the expenses of the creative team; director/choreographer, composer, &  musical director.
  • Our director & choreographer, Benjie Randall, is coming in from New York City fresh off of another new musical workshop which will soon be heading to Broadway! Composer, Phil Farugia, has recently joined the team and dove in head first creating amazing melodies and harmonies which are being turned over to our talented musical director, Allen Paglia. 
  • Donors are invited to attend our workshop performance on July 17, 2015. We will have a talkback so you may provide your valuable feedback to the creative team. Yes, you will be taking part in creating a musical!

The Impact

So what? Why do you care? What's in it for you?

  • This musical was written for two reasons; to create substantial roles for actresses and to showcase positive female role models. 
  • Supporting this project gives you the  power to present a positive female role model to the next generation. And have a hand in the beginning stages of this creative and collaborative process.  

Challenges

Creating a musical takes years of hard work and dedication. I see a long road ahead. But the very fact that I see a road is thrilling. That means the script has value, the story is good. I know this because I believe in myself, AND those who have read the script encourage me to push forward. (Trust me! If this project didn't have a future, my mentors, colleagues, and friends would have provided that feedback without hesitation.)

With your support,

we can take the next step to get this new musical ready for a full production. We can share our story. We can re-introduce Imogene Coca to the world and showcase a positive female role model to the next generation. 
Thank you!

story:
Summary

A piece of theatre, as it should be: dense, poetic, very visual and where lightness alternates often with melancholy. One is immediately taken by the fate of this young woman who is caught between the exile and her own mother. No word is too much, not a minute too long.

CĂTĂLIN DORIAN FLORESCU, writer

The show asks the question: 

What is it to feel "foreign"? 

A feeling experienced by many nowadays, including myself. As a foreigner in Germany for 3 years, I asked myself a lot of similar questions: What do I have to do to belong? How am I perceived? Am I undervalued? Am I still the same? All that I knew to be true about myself was under a sign of uncertainty.

Also, having seen on-site the refugee crisis burst out in Germany, I began to strongly feel the urge to speak about the absence of a place called "home". After 2 months of intense researching and interviews with refugees or other foreigners, I submitted a concept to the Cultural Department of the City of Munich, which accepted to provide the funding for staging the theatre play.


I had already known the novel "Why the child is cooking the polenta" by Aglaja Veteranyi, but it got a totally different weight the moment when I myself lived abroad just like the novel's heroine. It is a prose poem in 4 parts, the story of a Romanian family of artists, who is always on the road. The story is told from the perspective of the youngest child, a growing up girl. Full of illusions, the family pursues the promises of the West, a big house will be bought, the girl will become a film star, but the events take a completely different turn.

The one-woman-show premiered in Munich, Germany (MUCCA, The Pasinger Factory) with further stagings in Zürich, Switzerland (Cabaret Voltaire), Passau, Germany (Redoute Theatre) and Bucharest, Romania (Odeon Theatre), with the support of Kulturreferat Munich, Kulturreferat Passau, Goethe-Institut Bucharest and Romanian Cultural Institute Vienna. 

It can be staged in 3 different languages: English, German and Romanian with subtitles in 7 languages and it got an incredible positive response from audiences in 3 different countries, which motivates us to bring it to as many countries and audiences as possible.

What we need

The play has been selected for the world's largest solo theatre festival, United Solo, which takes place in New York between the 14th of September and the 19th of November 2017. It is scheduled on the 1st of November, at 07:30 PM, at the renown Theatre Row on Off-Broadway.

In order to be able to participate at this festival, we need your help.

The minimum sum for the project to be possible would be 2500$:

  • 1500$ - transport - 2 return tickets Bucharest - New York and transport within New York
  • 770$ - festival taxes
  • 50$ - book publishing rights
  • 180$ - money transfer and platform fees

In case we raise more money than that, we will be able to cover meals and accommodation as well.

“I am convinced that the decision to present Edith Alibec’s monologue at Cabaret Voltaire in Zürich, Switzerland, was very inspired. The strength and the innocence of Aglaja Veteranyi have found place in the scenic universe furnished with a  lot of talent. A full house laughed and wept bitterly in front on this endearing and unique story…”
IRINA CORNIȘTEANU, Director Romanian Cultural Institute Vienna

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the message by sharing this campaign with your friends and family.

If you have any other resources that you feel could help, please get in touch. We need as much publicity in New York or other fund raising opportunities as possible.

Much love,

Edith & Dana

story:
Short summary

Competing for glory in Northern Light's Battle for the Limelight on Aug. 29, our Edmonton Opera team — Sable Chan, Natasha Da Fonseca, Christina O'Dell and Nanc Price — has  a #licensetotrill. Each Edmonton theatre team that they're up against is raising money for their own company, and funds supporting #licensetotrill will go towards Edmonton Opera's chorus outreach initiatives. 

#licensetotrill is comprised of two sopranos, a mezzo-soprano and volunteer photographer Nanc Price, who works closely with EO staff, creative teams and chorus to capture the hard work behind the scenes and the magic onstage. But supporting #licensetotrill goes beyond these four ladies — the 50-member chorus is part of every EO stage production, as well as being part of community pop-up events, festivals and workshops. With this additional financial support, more of those opportunities can be created! 

What we need & what you get

Chorus members are compensated for their time and talent in mainstage productions and outreach events, so with these additional funds, we can create more opportunities for our chorus to participate in the community, as well as having larger ensembles perform. Even if we don't reach our goal of $500, any monies raised will still be applied to chorus outreach. 

All our perks offered are digital, meaning once we reach our goal, shipping and delivery is easier than ever! 

The impact

With diverse backgrounds — health professionals, educators, lawyers, musicians, government employees, students and more — the Edmonton Opera chorus shares a love for this larger-than-life art form. Being present in the community, beyond the Jubilee stage just three times per season, allows Edmontonians to become familiar with the chorus and the opera, in more casual and professional settings. Opera is everywhere, if you know where to look! 

Risks & challenges

Now in its second year, the organized Battle for the Limelight challenge presents low risks and challenges, after its overall success last year. Additionally, chorus outreach initiatives are always part of Edmonton Opera's season, so as mentioned above, funds raised only augment the opportunities. 

Plus, Sable, Nanc, Christina and Natasha have been involved with the opera in one way, shape or form since the 2012/13 season, so we know what they're capable of — preparing for an opera production isn't easy, after all! 

Other ways you can help

Sopranos and mezzos can be loud, but we need the community to spread the word too! Please share our campaign link with your friends and family, whether or not you're able to donate yourself!

story:
Robert Wood DANCE New York has the unique opportunity to bring our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives to Brazil to connect multiple cultures and expand the greater understanding of our shared humanity through dance. We're seeking funding of $8,500 to make this a reality. 

 
The plan:
Hosted by The Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (Unirio), RW DANCE will spend three weeks in Brazil, starting June 10th, 2016. Our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives will include performing, teaching and establishing a foundation for continuing work on The Koru Project.

We are thrilled to be invited to appear in a new musical, Tropicália, produced by Ouro Verde Produções and directed by Denise Telles, a professor in theatre and dance at Unirio.


While rehearsing for Tropicália, we'll also be teaching classes in Robert Wood's dance methodology at Unirio and workshops in performance technique at the Centro Coreográfico da Cidade do Rio de Janeiro.


This is just the beginning of long term cultural exchange. These initial engagements allow us to lay the groundwork for lasting relationships with Brazilian dancers, choreographers, composers and designers. Brazilian artists will be invited into RW DANCE's ongoing work, The Koru Project, a collaborative exploration of coastal and oceanic culture and it's relationship to koru, a silver fern native to New Zealand, symbolic of growth, new life and peace. 


With your support, our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives in Brazil can be made a reality!


What we need:

Flights: $2,200
Dance Artist stipends: $3,000
Food: $1300
Design materials: $1,500
Equipment and technical supplies: $375
Equipment travel insurance: $125
Accommodations: Generously underwritten by our hosts

Total: $8,500


Any amount you can contribute puts RW DANCE closer to facilitating cultural exchange and creating relationships with Brazilian artists. If contributing financially isn't an option for you, please share our campaign and spread the word!


ABOUT US:

Robert Wood DANCE - New York Inc is a 501(c)3 nonprofit focused on the preservation of the choreographic art and cultural exchange. In recent years, the company has traveled to Florence, Hong-Kong, Prague, and New Zealand with our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives. To read more, please visit
www.robertwooddance.org.
https://www.flickr.com/photos/robertwooddance/
@rwdancenewyork

Robert Wood DANCE New York has the unique opportunity to bring our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives to Brazil to connect multiple cultures and expand the greater understanding of our shared humanity through dance. We're seeking funding of $8,500 to make this a reality. 
 The plan: Hosted by The Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (Unirio), RW DANCE will spend three weeks in Brazil, starting June 10th, 2016. Our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives will include performing, teaching and establishing a foundation for continuing work on The Koru Project.We are thrilled to be invited to appear 
in a new musical, Tropicália, produced by Ouro Verde Produções and directed by Denise Telles, a professor in theatre and dance at Unirio. 
While rehearsing for Tropicália, we'll also be teaching classes in Robert Wood's dance methodology at Unirio and workshops in performance technique at the Centro Coreográfico da Cidade do Rio de Janeiro. 


This is just the beginning of long term cultural exchange. These initial engagements allow us to lay the groundwork for lasting 
relationships with Brazilian dancers, choreographers, composers and designers. Brazilian artists will be invited into RW DANCE's ongoing work, The Koru Project, a collaborative exploration of coastal and oceanic culture and it's relationship to koru, a silver fern native to New Zealand, symbolic of growth, new life and peace.  
With your support, our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives in Brazil can be made a reality!
What we need: Flights: $2,200 Dance Artist stipends: $3,000Food: $1300Design materials: $1,500Equipment and technical supplies: $375Equipment travel insurance: $125 Accommodations: Generously underwritten by our hostsTotal: $8,500

Any amount you can contribute puts RW DANCE closer to facilitating cultural exchange and creating relationships with Brazilian artists. If contributing financially isn't an option for you, please share our campaign and spread the word! 

ABOUT US:
 Robert Wood DANCE - New York Inc is a 501(c)3 nonprofit focused on 
the preservation of the choreographic art and cultural exchange. In 
recent years, the company has traveled to Florence, Hong-Kong, Prague, 
and New Zealand with our Dance and Diplomacy initiatives. To read more, 
please visit www.robertwooddance.org. https://www.flickr.com/photos/robertwooddance/@rwdancenewyork

story:
about {stairs}

my name is marygrace phillips, and i am an independent choreographer based in Atlanta, GA. i typically make work in dialogue with installation and poetry. 

this campaign is for my latest project called {stairs} in which i am exploring reconciliation and our boundedness in time. i've been wanting to make a work with a staircase for over a year now, and it's so exciting to see it coming together. this funding is vital to realizing the full creation of this work; it is also essential for giving us the tools to create the audience accessibility and engagement that helps us give more value back to the community. 


$$

  • This funding is going towards venue rental, event insurance, carpentry materials, flooring, costumes and artist wages. 
  • You'll receive PERKS based on the giving level you support -- shout-outs, tickets, poems and rehearsal invites. 
  • Supporting this project supports the growing diversity of Atlanta's dance voices and helps make local dance innovative and accessible. You'll be creating jobs for artists and technicians and helping partnerships between dance and education.
  • Check out my website marygracephillips.com for links to past projects.

Dreamteam

Making a dance is challenging and requires the dedication, time and talent of a lot of hardworking people. I'm so grateful to be working with such an amazing, brilliant team. 

The primary collaborators on this project are: Anicka Austin, Laura Briggs, Danny Davis, Clara Guyton, Jared Kelly, Erin Palovick and Nicholas Surbey

Other Ways You Can Help

spread the word! share the video! come to the show! 

Crowdfunding is a community effort so spread the word! share the video! come to the show!

_________________________

*MaryGrace Phillips is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of MaryGrace Phillips must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.*

story:
As a mid-career actor living in Australia and having spent several years as a stay at home parent, I went about looking for a great project where women were driving the work.  I wanted to find a story that portrayed strong female protagonists.  When I read the play ‘Dolores’ by Edward Allan Baker, I knew I found something worth doing. Not only because it portrays strong women but because it also deals with a subject that so badly needs to be brought into the light.

This campaign is to fund an event that brings intimate theatre and community activism together. 

Family violence is a serious problem.  Devastatingly, over a period of 12 months, on average, one person is killed every week in Australia as a result of family violence. 

'Dolores’ looks at the relationship of two sisters and the effect that domestic violence has had on their lives.  Baker states “I don't write about victims. I write character's fighting their last fight--knowing if they lose, there goes their last strand of dignity”.  It’s this message we want to leave our audiences with; this message we want to send to people who are currently living with family violence on a daily basis. Domestic violence can happen anywhere to anyone but You can escape the cycle, you can get help. 

With our skills as theatre makers, we want to put this issue under the microscope in a way and use the power of theatre to connect with our audiences and our community and bring about a moment of change.   This campaign is asking you to help us achieve our goal.

At the Anywhere Festival in Brisbane in May, we will present this one-act play for 8 performances in the Taylor King Gallery in Newmarket.

We want to challenge audiences to see that the cause of domestic and family violence is deeper than the individual and to change the way we all view the victims. We hope that our audience will take something away with them and a percentage of proceeds from ticket sales will go some way to helping real victims of family violence escape the cycle.

Our Team

Emma Skelton - Producer/Performer

Catarina Hebbard - Director

Ngoc Phan - Performer

Chancie Jessop - Production Designer

Kelly Calder - Lighting Designer

Rhianne Blackler - Stage Manager/Co-Producer

Please see our website for detailed biographies

What We Need 

We need your help to cover our production costs - these are things like performance royalties, public liability insurance, rehearsal space hire, lighting set up and equipment, hire of chairs, festival fees, printing and marketing costs, props, costume, and a minimum payment to our artists for their time and talent.  Getting the message out to as many people as possible is key and you can help here too by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with friends and interested people in your network .

The Impact

We hope the impact will be personal and far-reaching.  One night of connection through theatre can be profound in the lives of individuals and change communities.  By supporting our campaign you are joining us in the spirit of our goal – to create connection, awareness and support around an important issue that affects the society we all live in.  With the support of people like Tim Class-Auliff of White Ribbon and people like you in the wider community, there is potential for this project to reach a larger audience and to get our message of hope to people in need of it most. If we reach our goal then proceeds of ticket sales will go directly to assist White Ribbon Australia continue the campaign to end family violence.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge of getting a show up in the theatre is mostly financial.  Being a part of Anywhere Festival has helped us create connections to local business and with their support we are able to keep productions costs down. The success of this campaign will mean we can pay our artists for their work and a higher percentage of profits can go toward helping real families in need.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, please consider sharing the page and putting the word out about the festival and our small but ambitious project.  And tickets to see the show are on sale now at: https://anywherefest.com/dolores 

Thank you for your valuable time and consideration!

story:
A forest cannot grow without just the right elements coming together, and neither can we. 

My name is Twila Jane (many of you knew me as Khalima!), and I am the the producer, choreographer,  and community mama for Eternal Forest, a fiercely gorgeous theatrical dance taking place at Dogtown Dance Theatre in September of 2017. I'm also the owner and instructor at Electric Nomad Dance (formerly Illumination Dance Studio), where an amazing group of women and men explore their strength and passion through dance. 

We at Electric Nomad Dance studio are a group of primarily women who not only dance and create together, but who have a vision of making a positive impact on the world with our dance and art, while learning about dances of the world. In addition to weekly classes, workshops, and excellent technical training in classic and fusion forms of bellydance, we provide a space where are everyone is welcome to come as they are. All of our classes and most of our shows are sliding scale and donation based. We are the home to two companies that I am artistic director and choreographer for Laterna and Plume,  which are comprised of a diverse group of dancers who work hard, play hard, and have become a microcosm of what it means to truly work together. We live the art of symbiosis, and we would like to invite you to grow alongside us!

The narrative of Eternal Forest is a remedy for our times, a reminder that working together is essential to the human experience, and reflects the symbiotic relationship of nature as a metaphor for communities within the world. We feel strongly that creating this kind of art is wonderful practice for how we can navigate more compassionately in the world. Supporting community based art is supporting a more positive future for our world!

Thankfully, Eternal Forest is not a one-woman show; it's a uniquely multi-disciplinary work that includes diverse genders, ages, sizes, and ethnicities in its cast. It is deeply important to us that what is seen on stage is a reflection of the real world (even as fantastical as we make it at times!)

Check out the folks who we are working with us:

Laterna Dance Company
Rin Ajna's Myriad Project
Dawn Flores and The Forest Project 
Serena Spears
Alyssum Pohl
Heather Bailey of Host of Sparrows
RVA Dance Collective

Music: original music composed for the Eternal Forest by Adam Birce of Four Strings in collaboration with Twila Jane, and also by Rin Ajna for the Myriad Project. 

Film Backdrops by: Patrick Gregory Films
 

What We Need & What You Get

So much work has already gone into this production, and we are at a crucial time: we must start sewing costumes, building sets, and getting a rental home together for our out of town guests. We cannot take any chances in getting what we need for this, as the train has left the station! Together, I know our community can raise the funds needed to make this the best and most accessible show possible. When we have these material needs met, we can focus on the art and spirit of the work, AND we will have the ability to share the show with an audience on a completely donation basis. We will be able to take excerpts of the show to schools and other events, inspiring others to look at the world around them in new ways. In exchange for your contributions, we have a huge variety of perks, from front-row seats, classes, tarot readings, seeds and bulbs that were salvaged as part of Dawn Flores' conservation efforts at the Bliley Farm, and much more. 

This is what we need: 

Guest performer pay and lodging: $4150

This is a minimal stipend to cover the work of professional dancers who were chosen to collaborate with us, as well as the rent for housing while they are in town the week of the show.

House rental for a week for performers: $700

Groceries: $300


Dawn Flores: $300/ $100 for each show
Host of Sparrows: $300/ $100 for each show
Dana: $300/ $100 for each show
Rin Ajna: $300/ $100 for each show

~additional stipend for each member of Myriad: $1050 total/$150 each for 7 performers
Sami Te': $300/ $100 for each show
Alyssum Pohl: $300/ $100 for each show 
 

Costumes: $2000
$50 set aside for 40 costume pieces. This total will be used to purchase the print-to order fabric created by Dawn Flores, manufactured through Spoonflower.com. This total does not include the cost of additional embellishments. Our goal is to use as much material from the forest as possible, and to reuse/upcycle as much as possible. These costumes will be used again and again for performances and educational experiences.

Venue: $1500
This amount covers the theatre space for three shows and rehearsals, as well as crew pay.

Sets: $1000
While there is a focus on reusing and recycling materials, we will still have to buy items such as paint and print-on-demand fabric. This total also includes payment for backstage dressers and makeup artists.

Printing/promotional/marketing on recycled materials: $760 This will include postcards,         posters, playbills, and large display posters for outside of Dogtown Dance Theatre. 


Film backdrop creation: $500
Patrick Gregory Films is creating an original film in collaboration with Twila, incorporating film sequences captured by Dawn Flores of the Forest Project. This will create a choreographed backdrop for the dancers. This small stipend will be covering dozens of hours of work.

Original musical score: $500
Adam Birce of Four Strings has created an original score for the show, which is a combination of original songs, renditions of classic Arabic tunes, and field recordings, treated in Appalachian style. We are utilizing the format of a string quartet with expanded instrumentation, along with live singing and percussion.

Forest Project: $500
This amount is to cover the expenses of Dawn Flores, material contributions from the Forest Project, and set building and dressing.

Indiegogo Processing Fees: $872

________________________________________________

Total: $11,782

Whatever funds we collect, whether we reach our goal or not, will be put towards show production, with a priority on housing and feeding our guests.  The show must go on! 

In joining us in funding for Eternal Forest, you are making a commitment to stand by lady artists who are active in spreading the message of diverse community and remembrance of environmental concerns. Our goal is to humanize the forest, and to help people see themselves as an active participant in protection of our precious environment, and each other. 

We know that creating works like Eternal Forest does work to change perspectives. After Oceanic, our last theatrical production, the feedback was incredible. Our audience left hopeful; they felt moved, and they wanted to see the show again (and bring their friends and families!). They learned about ways that they can reduce their impact on the environment through shared materials, and saw another perspective on how we can handle social toxicity as well. We were told by the audience that the world needed more positive perspectives such as what we put forth, and a personal connection to the cultural and environmental issues that we face today. Best of all, Oceanic started a lot of conversations, and sparked people to take action in their own lives. Eternal Forest is yet another chapter in the living book of care we are writing!

Risks & Challenges

At this point, our greatest challenge is financial. We have already put a huge amount of work into the production already: the cast, show, music, video, and costume designs are already rolling, but we need materials to dance forward with! If we do not meet our goal, we will improvise, but the show will go on. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While we would love it if every supporter and friend could contribute, we understand that sometimes cash is hard to come by. We understand, and hope that you would consider sharing our campaign with friends and on social media, along with a message of why you think it is important for our work to be supported. If you are able to sponsor the show in a way that is not financial, please feel free to message twilajanedance@gmail.com. 

We love you, and can't wait to dance for you!

story:
Our fundraising goal is as ambitious as our play! We hope to raise $3,500 - enough to cover our festival fees, production supplies, event expenses, and transportation. We also believe that artists bring such light into the world with their exceptional capacity for storytelling, and as such we strongly embrace the ethic of paying our artists - writers, actors, directors, crew, collaborators, etc. All these factors are vital to bring the magical Land of Melanin to life.

This play is more than a fun experience for all audience members. It is an inspiration and a world-widening experience for all young people, particularly for young girls of color! We want our youth audience members to go into the world embracing their own power, knowledge, and fearlessness: their heroism.

FEMelanin is comprised of writers, directors, visual artists and melanin. Many of our members have years of Theater for Young Audience experience. We wanted create the change we wish to see in the world.

No donation is too small. We are grateful for any contribution. With the help of our community --YOU-- we can make magic happen! You can also help by spreading the word about our campaign.

story:
Step1 Theatre Project? What's that?

I'm glad you asked! Step1 Theatre Project has been operating in NYC and NJ, founded by Janelle Zapata & Jazmyn Arroyo, who found each other at Rutgers-Newark's theatre program. These two determined Latinas founded a dynamic organization looking to create and help create! Here are some of Step1's past productions... 

  • WHO AM I by Rodney Reyes (2016)
    • Presented at Planet Connections Theatre Festivity
    • Nominated for 5 awards including Outstanding Ensemble
    • Winner of 3 awards including Outstanding Overall Production of a Revival 
  • Falsehoods, Fallacies & Fairy Tales (or The Illustrated X-mas Sweater) by Ashley Lauren Rogers (2016)
    • Performed a near-sold out run at the Producers Club
  • A Crisis Called New York by Alisha Espinosa (2017)
    • Presented at FRIGID New York 
  • Snipped/Cut/Tied: Una Noche de Magia by Desi Moreno-Penson (2017)
    • Presented at Planet Connections Theatre Festivity
    • Nominated for 8 awards including Oustanding Overall Production of an Entire Evening of One-Acts
    • Winner of 3 awards including Outstanding Playwriting (Desi Moreno-Penson) 
  • Artists United for Puerto Rico: A Hurricane Relief Benefit (2017)
    • Presented at The Physics Theater (formerly The Elektra Theater) with 100% of proceeds going to hurricane relief on the ground
    • Relief efforts organized and carried out by non-profit organization, Regular Hero
  • The Vengeance Room by Michael Hagins (2018)
    • Presented at FRIGID New York 
    • Officially FRIGID 2018's "Most Disturbing Show"! 

 

What Artist Support are you providing? 

Well, you've got some great questions! It is so important to us to help our fellow creators break boundaries. Here are some events we've held for our fellow artists' support, all free of charge...

  • R&D (aka Reading & Drinking)
    • Organized by Benjamin-Ernest Abraham, R&D is a free, informal gathering of artists assembled together to read works in progress, including short plays, full-lengths, and musicals, followed by a dialogue on the piece's growth and development.
  • Step it Up! Workshop Series
    • Our free workshop Series invites expert artists of different areas of the indie theatre community to host free panels or workshops on various topics. Past workshops include Creating Trans & Non Binary Narratives for Performance (2017) hosted by Ashley Lauren  Rogers. 
  • Youth Outreach
    • Step1 has participated in youth outreach endeavors including participation in a Town Hall panel discussion with high school students on collaboration, and providing insight on professional theatre with high school & college students at Rutgers-NJIT's Rising Playwrights Festival. Step1 will be co-producing this workshop as of 2019!


So what's the money for?

Fair question! Since our company is motivated to not only being creators but helping others create, your donation contributes significantly to Step1's ability to find our own bold productions, while still being able to create space for others whose voices are often underrepresented. Your donation helps cover...

  • Rehearsal & Performance space
  • Artist stipends
  • Space for workshops & readings
  • Operational expenses (website, fiscal sponsorship, membership dues)
  • Props & materials for productions

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute a financial donation but are interested in helping out? Reach out to us! We are always seeking industry professionals for our Step it Up! Workshop series, artists interested in submitting pieces to our R&D Reading Series, and of course, always seeking new artists to collaborate with on our productions.

Interested in helping out? Contact us at info@step1theatreproject.org! 

Help us spread the word and share! 
 

#StartAtSTEP1 #S1TP #ArtistsSupportingArtists
story_txt:
Step1 Theatre Project? What's that?
I'm glad you asked! Step1 Theatre Project has been operating in NYC and NJ, founded by Janelle Zapata & Jazmyn Arroyo, who found each other at Rutgers-Newark's theatre program. These two determined Latinas founded a dynamic organization looking to create and help create! Here are some of Step1's past productions... 

WHO AM I by Rodney Reyes (2016)
Presented at Planet Connections Theatre Festivity
Nominated for 5 awards including Outstanding Ensemble
Winner of 3 awards including Outstanding Overall Production of a Revival 


Falsehoods, Fallacies & Fairy Tales (or The Illustrated X-mas Sweater) by Ashley Lauren Rogers (2016)Performed a near-sold out run at the Producers Club

A Crisis Called New York by Alisha Espinosa (2017)Presented at FRIGID New York 

Snipped/Cut/Tied: Una Noche de Magia by Desi Moreno-Penson (2017)
Presented at Planet Connections Theatre Festivity
Nominated for 8 awards including Oustanding Overall Production of an Entire Evening of One-Acts
Winner of 3 awards including Outstanding Playwriting (Desi Moreno-Penson) 


Artists United for Puerto Rico: A Hurricane Relief Benefit (2017)
Presented at The Physics Theater (formerly The Elektra Theater) with 100% of proceeds going to hurricane relief on the ground
Relief efforts organized and carried out by non-profit organization, Regular Hero


The Vengeance Room by Michael Hagins (2018)

story:
Who Are We?

Red Bear is run by Tracy Martin (Artistic Director) & Aoibhéann McCann (Company Manager). We have worked together since 2012 and are proud to say that our company and its work has gone from strength to strength.  Our website can be found here.

WRAPPED (2014) was nominated for the Stewart Parker Award, the Prix Europa 2018 and was a BBC Audio Award Finalist 2019,  HARDER FASTER MORE was nominated for the Fishamble New Writing Award 2015, won an IMRO in 2017 and won Silver at the New York Festivals Awards, COAST was nominated for the Fishamble New Writing Award and the First Fortnight Award 2016. Filming for "Sister This" (funded by Screen Ireland),  a script inspired by HARDER FASTER MORE, has just wrapped. 

Beyond the Red Bear house, most recently, Tracy's play "Dublin Will Show You How You" premiered at The Abbey, Ireland's National Theatre, while Aoibhéann has just completed a five week run playing Blanche DuBois in "A Streetcar Named Desire" at The Lyric Theatre, Belfast. We're a busy, industrious bunch!

This year we want to make PATCHWORK, written & performed by Louis Deslis and directed by Tracy Martin. We have a breathtaking team behind it to make it the show it deserves to be and we believe this story should be told.

It is important to keep challenging ourselves as a company and we want this next show to challenge us AND you. It would mean an awful lot to be able to give this production the financial support it needs to really fly. We know times are tough and anything you can contribute (no matter what size) would be hugely appreciated.

The following are some of our terrific team:

Director & Producer: Tracy Martin

Dramaturg: Lee Coffey

Movement: Kate Finegan

Voice Support & Producer: Aoibhéann McCann

 

What We Need & What You Get

€3200 would help:

  1. Design and make an amazing set, complete with technology and 'high end' finish.

  2. Costume Louis, an essential part of our storytelling. 

  3. Light our set and give you an exhilarating (Yes. We promise!) theatre experience.

  4. Give our artists a (very) nominal fee for the time they use to make the show.

  5. Us sleep at night.

The Impact

In the past we have been lucky to fund and create hit shows on a shoestring budget. It was exhausting and challenging but we were exhilarated by the response and the work that has been born from that. 

Patchwork is special. We have gained experience of work within and outside our own company and we want to give this show the support, the insight and the airtime it deserves. We believe it will reach into your heart and hold a mirror up to you and the world and, for that, we desperately want to make it!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute it would also be brilliant if you might share this page or spread the word any way you can. 

Thank You so much,

Tracy, Aoibhéann & Louis

story:
Wer bin ich

Mein Name ist Alpar Fendo. Ich bin Bauchredner und Zauberkünstler und das seit meiner Kindheit. Ich war 14 Jahre in der Wirtschaftsprüfung tätig, ehe ich dann aus meinem bürgerlichen Beruf ausgetreten bin um mir einen lang gehegten Traum zu erfüllen - eine eigene Show zu produzieren. 
Mein Projekt geisterte schon lange in meinem Kopf. Aber, jetzt bin ich dabei meine Gedanken und Ideen in Taten umzusetzen. Und genau hierfür brauche ich noch Ihre Unterstützung.

Das Projekt
Eine Bühnen Show welches Bauchreden (Puppenspiel) und Stand Up Comedy mit magischen Elementen (Zauberkunst) vereint. Ist nicht neu? Doch! Denn es handelt sich hierbei nicht um ein Nummernprogramm, sondern um eine Konzeptshow. Und darin liegt auch die Herausforderung. Jeder Baustein des Programms ordnet sich dem allgemein gewählten Thema unter.  Der künstlerische Wert hängt von der Umsetzung ab und davon, wie sich das gewählte Thema und die Genren Bauchreden, Zauberkunst und Stand Up gegenseitig stützen und ergänzen.
Das ist neuartig in diesen Genren und auch eine Herausforderung, ein Programm so zu gestalten, dass eine Geschichte erzählt wird. Lustig, komisch, magisch, aber auch nachdenklich stimmend, denn Comedy darf auch mal gesellschaftskritisch sein, abseits vom mainstream.
Ausgangspunkt des Stücks: Die Außerirdischen sind längst auf dem Weg zu uns. Doch wie lassen sich die fremden Gattungen in die deutsche Gesellschaft integrieren? Und ist Deutschland auf alle Eventualitäten vorbereitet? 

Dabei schlüpfe ich in die Rolle des Integrationsbeamten und übersteigere so ironisch die eigenen Erfahrungen meiner Familie, als meine Eltern in den 1960er-Jahren nach Deutschland kamen. So entsteht ein Stand-up-Comedyprogramm mit ausgefeiltem Puppenspiel und wahrlich magischen Momenten. 

Was ich brauche

Das Projekt benötigte drei ausserirdische Puppen, ein UFO, ein UFO Wohnwagen, ein Bühnenbild, technisches Equipment, gestaltete Zauber Requisiten. Zu dem kommen Kosten für Dramaturgie und auch Regie. Dafür brauche ich Ihre Unterstützung: 
- für einen Regisseur 1500 €
- für den Text Review 800 €
- ich brauche Geld für Einspieler und Clips 800 €
- ich brauche Geld für den Probenraum 100€
Indiegogo nimmt einen kleinen Prozentsatz des Geldes dieser Kampagne. Ich habe dies in meinen Zielen berücksichtigt.

Lassen Sie uns über das reden, was Sie bekommen! Ich biete Ihnen für Ihre Unterstützung folgendes an:
- eine Close Up Magic Show zu ihrem Geburtstag (in Berlin und Umgebung)
- Freikarten zu der Show "ALLES AUSSER IRDISCH" und beste Sitzplätze im Theater (die Tickets kosten normalerweise 19-21 €)
- nach der Show ein Foto mit Ihnen und meinen Puppen
- ein Set an Plakate und Postkarten der Puppen, natürlich mit Signierung
- eine eigens gestaltete Dose Apfelsaftschorle mit dem Motiv des neuen Programms und dazu "Space" Kekse ( auf den Keksen sind die Puppen abgebildet)
- ein Drechselkurs in meiner Werkstatt wo ich meine Zauber Requisiten selbst gebaut habe.

Die Folgen

Diese Show kann einen positiven Einfluss auf diejenigen haben, die es sehen. Es ist nicht nur Comedy und lustig, stellenweise auch gesellschaftskritisch und zum nachdenken animierend. Unterhaltung ohne Fingerzeig, aber abseits vom Mainstream, erzählt durch eine Geschichte. 

Bitte besuchen Sie meine neue Webseite www.allesausserirdisch.de und machen Sie sich ein Bild meiner Arbeit. Ich hoffe, dass ich durch Ihre Unterstützung mein Projekt auf eine nächste Stufe legen kann. Dramaturgie und Regiearbeit sind dafür eine wichtige Voraussetzung.


Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Erzählen Sie Ihren Freunden und Bekannten von meinem Projekt. Schauen Sie auf meiner Webseite vorbei. Teilen Sie meine Webseite auf ihren Sozialen Medien.

Besuchen Sie meine Show im Theater O-TonArt in Berlin-Schöneberg. Berlin ist immer reine Reise Wert!

Schicken Sie Ihre Berliner Freunde und Bekannte dorthin. Ich freue mich wenn Sie mich unterstützen. Jeder Beitrag zählt und schon bald kann ich vielleicht auf Tour gehen und Sie in Ihrer Stadt besuchen!
