story:
All's Well That Ends Happy

A new play by Sarah Shaefer, directed by Daniel Talbott
Produced by Breezy Productions, Addie Johnson-Talbott and Mermaid Sand Productions

In All's Well That Ends Happy, a rising male porn star and an amateur porn actress find themselves united in their determination to rise quickly in the porn industry, only to have their careers cut short by a jealous and ruthless director. In this modern day Greek tragedy, greed and ambition spark the gasoline of gluttonous excess and fame obsession, exploding into the emptiness of our technological age where selfies, hashtags, and narcissism define success.

What We Need & What You Get

After the multi-award-nominated sold out run in NY of Sarah Shaefer’s first play - THE GIN BABY - directed by Daniel Talbott at IRT last year, Shaefer and Talbott are teaming up again on ALL’S WELL THAT ENDS HAPPY.  Because of how small and tight the budgets are on many showcases like this one, most of the production funds have to go into every aspect of mounting and running the show, with understandably very little left over to pay artists. We want to experiment with building a budget that supports the production and at the same time dedicates over half of the budget to the salaries of the artists working on the show. 

We are attempting to raise $22,000 of our $35,000 budget with your help through Indiegogo. Every dollar that you contribute will go directly into the pockets of the people involved - cast, designers, crew, and creative. We are committed to raising all the other money we need for the show - from space, production, press, and marketing costs - by ourselves and from other sources. Again, every dollar donated to this campaign goes directly to the artists involved.

We have lots of perks - Facebook shout outs, tarot card and astrology readings, invites to events leading up to the production, and opening night tickets!  

The Impact

We wanted to keep this campaign simple and straightforward:

  • Every dollar here will go directly to artist and staff stipends and nowhere else.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You might not be able to  contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  Share about it on Facebook and Twitter!  "Like" us on Facebook too!  https://www.facebook.com/mermaidsandproductions and https://www.facebook.com/home.php

story:
default company
                           θεατρικές παραστάσεις για παιδιά και ενήλικες
                                     - www.defaultcompany.org –

                                                   απευθυνόμαστε
                                           σε φίλους, σε γνωστούς
                           και σε οποιονδήποτε άλλον - φορέα ή άτομο -
                           ενδιαφέρεται για τις δράσεις της ομάδας μας
                                         και ζητάμε τη στήριξή σας
                  ώστε να καλυφθεί ένα μέρος του προϋπολογισμού
                                        για τις επόμενες παραγωγές μας
____________________________________________________________________
                                                  τo indiegogo
                                     είναι μία μεγάλη πλατφόρμα
                   ανεξάρτητης χρηματοδότησης πολιτιστικών δράσεων
                   ο λογαριασμός της default company στο indiegogo
                      θα παραμείνει ενεργός για τις επόμενες επτά ημέρες,

                                μέχρι τη Δευτέρα 26 Ιανουαρίου 2015
____________________________________________________________________                                                  


                              ευχαριστούμε πολύ για το ενδιαφέρον σας
                 Αλεξία Μπεζίκη, Καλλιρρόη Παπαδοπούλου, Ξένια Θεμελή


  



το παιδί και τα μάγια

default company 

προτείνεται σε παιδιά ηλικίας 4-8 ετών

     

Ένα θέαμα όχι απλώς για παιδιά, αλλά γύρω από τα παιδιά, και τη μαγική δύναμη τους να μπορούν να ξαναγνωρίσουν και να αλλάξουν τον κόσμο.

H default company, μετά την καλλιτεχνική της επιτυχία με τις «Ιστορίες καιρού» στη Στέγη Γραμμάτων και Τεχνών, παρουσιάζει στο Θέατρο Πόρτα «Το παιδί και τα μάγια»: Mια παράσταση εμπνευσμένη από την όπερα του Maurice Ravel και της Colette “L’ enfant et les sortileges”. Ένα εικαστικό θέαμα με κίνηση και ζωντανή μουσική που αφηγείται με χιούμορ και τρυφερότητα το όνειρο ενός αγοριού που γκρεμίζει τον κόσμο που του επιβάλλεται και τον ξαναστήνει από την αρχή. Πρόκειται για ένα ταξίδι ονείρου, για μία διαδοχή εικόνων και ιδεών, μέσα από τις οποίες το παιδί ξανασυναντάει τον κόσμο των μικρών πραγμάτων, τα οποία έχει προηγουμένως κακομεταχειριστεί.

Στο παραμύθι αυτό, μέσα από ένα παιχνίδι κανόνων και παραβάσεων, απαγορεύσεων και αντιδράσεων, απαιτήσεων και προσδοκιών, το παιδί πειραματίζεται με τη ζωή, κάνει λάθη, αναγνωρίζει τα συναισθήματά του και έρχεται αντιμέτωπο με τις επιλογές του. Στην πορεία αυτής της διαδρομής, κάπου μεταξύ ονείρου και πραγματικότητας, το παιδί θα συναντήσει έναν κόσμο όπου αντικείμενα, άνθρωποι και ζωόμορφα πλάσματα συνομιλούν, το έμψυχο συνυπάρχει με το άψυχο, μεγέθη και κλίμακες ανατρέπονται, χαρακτήρες εξαφανίζονται ως «δια μαγείας», σκιές και αντικατοπτρισμοί διασταυρώνονται.

Ο έντονα χειροποίητος χαρακτήρας της παράστασης, η αφήγηση του παραμυθιού που προκύπτει μέσα από όσο γίνεται πιο ομιλητικές εικόνες, η κίνηση, η μετακίνηση, η πρωτότυπη ζωντανή μουσική που βρίσκεται σε συνομιλία με την κλασική μουσική και συνολικότερα, η αισθητηριακή πρόσληψη του βασικού μύθου, εμπνέουν τα παιδιά να σκέφτονται δημιουργικά και αισιόδοξα.

«Το παιδί και τα μάγια» είναι ένα παραμύθι που μιλάει για την ελευθερία στο να φανταζόμαστε.

Η μουσική και τα τραγούδια της παράστασης κυκλοφόρησαν και διατίθενται σε CD στο φουαγέ του Θεάτρου Πόρτα, σε συσκευασία που μπορεί να γίνει και μάσκα.

Ιδέα-Κείμενο-Δραματουργία–default company σε συνεργασία με τον Τάσο Κουκουτά

Σκηνοθεσία Καλλιρρόη Παπαδοπούλου, Ξένια Θεμελή, Αλεξία Μπεζίκη

Χορογραφία default company σε συνεργασία με τους χορευτές

Σκηνικά Ευαγγελία Θεριανού

Κοστούμια Κλαίρ Μπρέισγουελ

Φωτισμοί Μαρία Αθανασοπούλου

Μουσική Αντώνης Γεώργου, Αντώνης Καββαδίας

Παραγωγή default company

Βοηθοί ενδυματολόγου Μυρτώ Κοσμοπούλου, Ειρήνη Κάμαρη

Οργάνωση παραγωγής Ζωή Μουσχή

Φωτογραφίες Αλέξης Ευσταθόπουλος

Ερμηνεύουν Αλέξανδρος Βαρδαξόγλου, Αλεξία Μπεζίκη, Ιωάννα Παρασκευοπούλου, Ξένια Θεμελή / Νατάσα Σαραντοπούλου, Σταύρος Σβήγκος

Λίγα λόγια για την default company

Η default company δημιουργήθηκε από την Ξένια Θεμελή, την Αλεξία Μπεζίκη και την Καλλιρρόη Παπαδοπούλου. Τα μέλη της ομάδας σπούδασαν θέατρο και χορό στη Θεσσαλονίκη, τη Βέρνη και το Λονδίνο. Η ομάδα δραστηριοποιείται από το 2003 στο χώρο του θεάτρου, του χοροθεάτρου και της σύγχρονης performance. Προηγούμενες Παραγωγές: Ιστορίες Καιρού (2012-2013), On the Run (2009), On the Blink (2007),Almost there (2006), Forced feeding (2005), Τα γενέθλια της Ινφάντα (2003).

Σημείωμα default company

«Πώς να κρυφτείς απ’ τα παιδιά, έτσι κι’ αλλιώς τα ξέρουν όλα»

Όχι μόνο για τα παιδιά, το θέατρο παραμένει πάντα ένα παιχνίδι ταυτίσεων, μεταθέσεων, παραξενίσματος και γοητείας. Για να γοητεύσουμε το παιδικό μας κοινό δεν μας αρέσει να εμπιστευόμαστε εντυπωσιακά εφέ. Οι παραστάσεις μας θέλουμε να έχουν χαρακτήρα χειροποίητο και να φέρουν τα παιδιά σε επαφή με τα επιμέρους στοιχεία της θεατρικής πράξης. Επιλέγουμε να χρησιμοποιούμε στοιχεία σωματικού θεάτρου, ακροβατικά, τρόπους από το θέατρο σκιών, από το σύγχρονο και τον κλασικό χορό. Παράλληλα οργανώνουμε και ορισμένες, ελάχιστες, ήσυχες σκηνές που απαιτούν λίγη παραπάνω από την προσοχή των παιδιών. Για να κατανοήσουν ότι δεν είναι όλα εύκολα, ότι να, ο χειμώνας μπορεί να είναι λίγο πιο μελαγχολικός από το καλοκαίρι, αλλά αυτό δεν πειράζει, ίσως-ίσως αυτό να είναι και το κρυμμένο αίνιγμα των πραγμάτων.

default company                           θεατρικές παραστάσεις για παιδιά και ενήλικες                                     - www.defaultcompany.org –                                                   απευθυνόμαστε                                           σε φίλους, σε γνωστούς                           και σε οποιονδήποτε άλλον - φορέα ή άτομο -                           ενδιαφέρεται για τις δράσεις της ομάδας μας                                         και ζητάμε τη στήριξή σας                  ώστε να καλυφθεί ένα μέρος του προϋπολογισμού                                        για τις επόμενες παραγωγές μας____________________________________________________________________                                                  τo indiegogo                                     είναι μία μεγάλη πλατφόρμα                   ανεξάρτητης χρηματοδότησης πολιτιστικών δράσεων                   ο λογαριασμός της default company στο indiegogo                      θα παραμείνει ενεργός για τις επόμενες επτά ημέρες,                                μέχρι τη Δευτέρα 26 Ιανουαρίου 2015____________________________________________________________________                                                                                 ευχαριστούμε πολύ για το ενδιαφέρον σας                 Αλεξία Μπεζίκη, Καλλιρρόη Παπαδοπούλου, Ξένια Θεμελή   
το παιδί και τα μάγιαdefault company  
προτείνεται σε παιδιά ηλικίας
4-8 ετών
      
Ένα θέαμα όχι απλώς για
παιδιά, αλλά γύρω από τα παιδιά, και τη μαγική δύναμη τους να μπορούν να
ξαναγνωρίσουν και να αλλάξουν τον κόσμο.

επιτυχία με τις «Ιστορίες καιρού» στη Στέγη Γραμμάτων και Τεχνών, παρουσιάζει

για μία διαδοχή εικόνων και ιδεών, μέσα από τις οποίες το παιδί ξανασυναντάει τον
κόσμο των μικρών πραγμάτων, τα οποία έχει προηγουμένως κακομεταχειριστεί.

ανατρέπονται, χαρακτήρες εξαφανίζονται ως «δια μαγείας», σκιές
και αντικατοπτρισμοί διασταυρώνονται.
Ο έντονα χειροποίητος χαρακτήρας
της παράστασης, η αφήγηση του παραμυθιού που προκύπτει μέσα από όσο γίνεται πιο

αισιόδοξα.
«Το παιδί και τα μάγια» είναι ένα παραμύθι που μιλάει για
την ελευθερία στο να φανταζόμαστε.
Η μουσική και τα τραγούδια

σε συσκευασία που μπορεί να γίνει και μάσκα.

story:
We’re gearing up for our 2018 show!  Last year we had a spectacular turnout, and SO many great dancers!

This year, we’re hoping to do even more to promote the fabulous dancers in Humboldt.   We’re awarding another cash scholarship, and we’ll be another lucky dancer will get a private Just Turns session with Ikolo Griffin of San Francisco Ballet, Joffrey Ballet, and Dance Theatre of Harlem.

If you’re a dancer, please go to Dancing Stars of Humboldt dot com and download an audition packet.  Any dancer, or group of dancers, can audition, and you can audition more than one piece.  We accept all ages and all dance styles.  The only requirement is that at least 51% of your group has to live in Humboldt County.   

Everybody else, you have a job to do too!  We need your help to give our local dancers this amazing experience of auditioning and performing in a truly professional setting, and to give them a chance at scholarships that can further their education.

Please post your support of Dancing Stars of Humboldt to all of your social media, and if you can, please donate a dollar (or more!) through our Indiegogo campaign.   This is how we raise all the money to put the show in the theatre, and fund our scholarships. 

Auditions are January 27th, and the show is March 10th, at the beautiful Arkley Center for the Performing Arts!  

Now, go ahead and share this to Facebook, Instagram, and everywhere else, and send us a few bucks at Indiegogo!   See you at the show!   

(yes, you.  Do it right now, ok?   So you don’t forget…thanks!)

story:
Romance at the Shoe Factory

A couple tells the story of how they met, only to discover amidst the mounting peculiarity of their story that their two accounts of the relationship vary drastically. Speculations of adultery, murder, and fascist shoe factories abound in this dinner-double-date play.

Sam French OOB

This festival takes place every August in New York City. 30 short plays from around the world are performed in a 5-night series, culminating in a day of performance for the selected finalists, and publication by Samuel French for the selected winners. This is a huge honor, and a really fun opportunity! 

What's the money for?

The money will go primarily toward paying Gillian's collaborators, who have so generously agreed to lend their time and talent to this project. It will also supplement the purchases of costumes and props.

story:
Short Summary

Blue Butterfly Productions are partnering with a team of young, talented creatives to bring the most touching and currently relevant play, Precious Little Talent, to the Courtyard Theatre this October!

Precious Little Talent explores the plight of two young people with opposing world views, Joey and Sam, as they struggle to interact with the realities of life, love, hope and relevance in a seemingly hostile and complicated world. The play also explores the story of George, an elderly gentleman navigating his retirement years with Dementia – the insufferable disease which threatens to impact everyone he loves.

 

 

We truly believe that this play deserves a platform and as a new and emerging team, we just need a little bit of help to get it off the ground. Dementia is a subject that is not explored enough on stage and this play directly captures the experience through the eyes of the beholder, which we believe to be a rare gift! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are looking to raise £3,000 to get Precious Little Talent to the stage! 

 

 

We have successfully secured the rights to put on this play in October with Ella Hickson and her team and all we need now is £500 to be able to pay for them. We are over the moon that the playwright has given us the green light to bring her writing to life and we hope that you can help us find this money to get over this small but very important hurdle. 

 

 

We have the most incredibly talented actors on board for Precious Little Talent! There will be 7 weeks of rehearsal for our team followed by a three week run of the play. We are passionate about supporting our actors on their journey's - not only on a career level but also by making sure that they can afford to quite literally get to work!

 

 

Our set is one of the most important and exciting elements of our production. Precious Little Talent is mostly set in the slightly aged apartment in New York City belonging to 'George'. We need to be able to break down the set after each performance, so we are looking to spend a good chunk of the budget on a few really important pieces of furniture that represent George and his life in this apartment living with Dementia. The armchair for the character represents a real home comfort and a place to feel safe when everything gets a little too much. Take a look at our perk 'Astor Place' if you want to get your hands on our original set design sketches! 

 

We are also looking for around £500 to market the show! Artwork, posters, campaign videos and flyers and essential to make sure this play reaches the audience it needs. If you want to get your hands on a signed copy of our poster delivered straight to your door, please see the 'Williamsburg' perk now...

If we do not find the entire £3000, we will prioritise spending what we do raise on the set design. All the factors mentioned above are so important to the success of our production and we so appreciate any and all donations to help us bring this show to life! 

 

 

We wanted to get creative with our perks and to offer you some truly personal and unique gifts completely specific to the show at this time. Inspired by some of our favourite areas of Brooklyn and New York, our perks lead you through the journey we believe the characters would have off the page... Perhaps one day you might want to grab life by the cojones and follow in Joey's footsteps?

 

Meet The Team

 

Producer - Grace Lewis (Blue Butterfly Productions)

Grace is a producer and actor based in London. With a heavy background in events management and an irritating obsession to see a project to it's completion, Grace created Blue Butterfly Productions earlier this year to follow her love for producing. Most recently she sold out the all female performance evening PLUG IN at the Canal Cafe Theatre soon to be returning next month. Earlier this year Grace also produced the short film Angel directed by BERLIN Directors which will be hitting the festival circuits next year. Having lived and trained in New York City, this play holds a special place in Grace's heart. She dedicates her experience working on Precious Little Talent to her beautiful grandma Rita, who sadly passed away from Dementia in December 2016. 

 

Director - Brock Elwick

Brock is a British theatre and film director. At a young age, Brock entered the entertainment industry as an actor and his experiences on set heavily influenced his focus upon character-driven storytelling. Brock understands that the most compelling elements of any production is the audience’s ability to empathise with the story and characters, with universal human truths being the reason any of us seeks out entertainment in any artistic medium. Brock has trained at the University of the Arts London and Raindance and his previous works include Nothing Like The Sun and Three Hail Marys. 

 

Associate Producer & Actress - Marta Kane

Marta is an actress and producer based in London. Since studying theatre at Goldsmiths College and finishing her Meisner Technique training at The Actors Temple in London she has worked on numerous projects, both on stage and screen. Her latest leading role in a short period drama Lula has earned her a Best Actor in a Female Role award at the 2017 Richard Harris International Film Festival.

 

Production Designer - Francesca Jones

Francesca is a British third year student studying BA Fine Art at the University of the Arts London, Chelsea College. She had her first professional experience at the BBC in 2014 assisting the Art Director with the second TV series of The Paradise. She returned again in 2015, with the second TV series of Atlantis. Last year, she was asked back to work on the ITV film, 'Born a King' where she was responsible for designing and sourcing the props needed. Francesca is bringing her experience in television to the stage with this production, hoping to use her passion for visual expression to captivate a live audience. 

 

Stage Manager - Zoe Beeny

Zoe is a second year student studying English and Drama at Goldsmiths, University of London where she is developing her writing, directorial and dramaturgical practices. Most recently she was dramaturg for a devised piece based on The London Riots 2011 and Alice Through the Looking Glass which was awarded a first class grade. She is very excited to be Stage Managing her first play in London to combine her previous backstage and technical work in lighting, sound and props.

 

 

'George'- Mark Keegan

Mark has just finished a successful run at this year’s Edinburgh Fringe playing Diamond Danny/ Uncle Kev in ‘Istanbul: You’ll Never Walk Alone’  (From The Gut Theatre) Voted ‘Outstanding Fringe Debut’ by Theatre Weekly; In June he reprised his role as Dennis in ‘Flutter’ (Compulsive Theatre) for a sold-out run at Soho Theatre; TV work includes playing Tom in Season 1 of ‘On Order And Away’ (available on Amazon Prime); Mark was also proud to play the part of Liam in the short film ‘The Director’ for Shout Out UK. A comedy highlighting the plight of the homeless. The film was shortlisted for LIFF’18.

 

 

'Sam' - Henry George Lewis

Henry trained at the International School of Screen Acting and has since been busy filming various short films and music videos. He played Tim, the lead in ‘No Such Thing As Monsters,’ directed by Jon White and Heath in Big Heath’s music video, ‘Going Home,’ directed by Liam Morgann for Floating Goat Productions. His most recent credit includes playing Merrick in feature film ‘Game Over,’ directed by academy award winner Ben Kent. Henry has just finished a year run playing the lead in a show called Heroes following the path of three kids on the hunt for David Bowie! 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to read this all the way to the end. 

We sincerely hold a special place for you in our Precious Little Talent heart's and if you can't donate anything, we completely understand! We would be forever grateful if you could simply spread the word about the production and play and please do share this page with anyone you might think would be interested in helping us or coming to see the show!

Please follow us on social media :)

Twitter: @BlueButterflyPr

Instagram: @preciouslittletalent

Facebook: @preciouslittletalentcourtyardtheatre

We promise to keep you up to date every step of the way...

Thanks again! 

Grace, Brock, Marta, Fran and rest of the Precious Little Talent team x

We are looking to raise £3,000 to get Precious Little Talent to the stage! 
 

 
We have successfully secured the rights to put on this play in October with Ella Hickson and her team and all we need now is £500 to be able to pay for them. We are over the moon that the playwright has given us the green light to bring her writing to life and we hope that you can help us find this money to get over this small but very important hurdle. 
 

 
We have the most incredibly talented actors on board for Precious Little Talent! There will be 7 weeks of rehearsal for our team followed by a three week run of the play. We are passionate about supporting our actors on their journey's - not only on a career level but also by making sure that they can afford to quite literally get to work!
 

 
Our set is one of the most important and exciting elements of our production. Precious Little Talent is mostly set in the slightly aged apartment in New York City belonging to 'George'. We need to be able to break down the set after each performance, so we are looking to spend a good chunk of the budget on a few really important pieces of furniture that represent George and his life in this apartment living with Dementia. The armchair for the character represents a real home comfort and a place to feel safe when everything gets a little too much. Take a look at our perk 'Astor Place' if you want to get your hands on our original set design sketches! 
 


We are also looking for around £500 to market the show! Artwork, posters, campaign videos and flyers and essential to make sure this play reaches the audience it needs. If you want to get your hands on a signed copy of our poster delivered straight to your door, please see the 'Williamsburg' perk now...
If we do not find the entire £3000, we will prioritise spending what we do raise on the set design. All the factors mentioned above are so important to the success of our production and we so appreciate any and all donations to help us bring this show to life! 
 

 
We wanted to get creative with our perks and to offer you some truly personal and unique gifts completely specific to the show at this time. Inspired by some of our favourite areas of Brooklyn and New York, our perks lead you through the journey we believe the characters would have off the page... Perhaps one day you might want to grab life by the cojones and follow in Joey's footsteps?
 
Meet The Team
 

Producer - Grace Lewis (Blue Butterfly Productions)

Grace is a producer and actor based in London. With a heavy background in events management and an irritating obsession to see a project to it's completion, Grace created Blue Butterfly Productions earlier this year to follow her love for producing. Most recently she sold out the all female performance evening PLUG IN at the Canal Cafe Theatre soon to be returning next month. Earlier this year Grace also produced the short film Angel directed by BERLIN Directors which will be hitting the festival circuits next year. Having lived and trained in New York City, this play holds a special place in Grace's heart. She dedicates her experience working on Precious Little Talent to her beautiful grandma Rita, who sadly passed away from Dementia in December 2016. 
 
Director - Brock Elwick

Brock is a British theatre and film director. At a young age, Brock entered the entertainment industry as an actor and his experiences on set heavily influenced his focus upon character-driven storytelling. Brock understands that the most compelling elements of any production is the audience’s ability to empathise with the story and characters, with universal human truths being the reason any of us seeks out entertainment in any artistic medium. Brock has trained at the University of the Arts London and Raindance and his previous works include Nothing Like The Sun and Three Hail Marys. 
 
Associate Producer & Actress - Marta Kane

Marta is an actress and producer based in London. Since studying theatre at Goldsmiths College and finishing her Meisner Technique training at The Actors Temple in London she has worked on numerous projects, both on stage and screen. Her latest leading role in a short period drama Lula has earned her a Best Actor in a Female Role award at the 2017 Richard Harris International Film Festival.
 
Production Designer - Francesca Jones

Francesca is a British third year student studying BA Fine Art at the University of the Arts London, Chelsea College. She had her first professional experience at the BBC in 2014 assisting the Art Director with the second TV series of The Paradise. She returned again in 2015, with the second TV series of Atlantis. Last year, she was asked back to work on the ITV film, 'Born a King' where she was responsible for designing and sourcing the props needed. Francesca is bringing her experience in television to the stage with this production, hoping to use her passion for visual expression to captivate a live audience. 
 
Stage Manager - Zoe Beeny
Zoe is a second year student studying English and Drama at Goldsmiths, University of London where she is developing her writing, directorial and dramaturgical practices. Most recently she was dramaturg for a devised piece based on The London Riots 2011 and Alice Through the Looking Glass which was awarded a first class grade. She is very excited to be Stage Managing her first play in London to combine her previous backstage and technical work in lighting, sound and props.


 
 
'George'- Mark Keegan
Mark has just finished a successful run at this year’s Edinburgh Fringe playing Diamond Danny/ Uncle Kev in ‘Istanbul: You’ll Never Walk Alone’  (From The Gut Theatre) Voted ‘Outstanding Fringe Debut’ by Theatre Weekly; In June he reprised his role as Dennis in ‘Flutter’ (Compulsive Theatre) for a sold-out run at Soho Theatre; TV work includes playing Tom in Season 1 of ‘On Order And Away’ (available on Amazon Prime); Mark was also proud to play the part of Liam in the short film ‘The Director’ for Shout Out UK. A comedy highlighting the plight of the homeless. The film was shortlisted for LIFF’18.

 
 
'Sam' - Henry George Lewis
Henry trained at the International School of Screen Acting and has since been busy filming various short films and music videos. He played Tim, the lead in ‘No Such Thing As Monsters,’ directed by Jon White and Heath in Big Heath’s music video, ‘Going Home,’ directed by Liam Morgann for Floating Goat Productions. His most recent credit includes playing Merrick in feature film ‘Game Over,’ directed by academy award winner Ben Kent. Henry has just finished a year run playing the lead in a show called Heroes following the path of three kids on the hunt for David Bowie! 

 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Thank you for taking the time to read this all the way to the end. 
We sincerely hold a special place for you in our Precious Little Talent heart's and if you can't donate anything, we completely understand! We would be forever grateful if you could simply spread the word about the production and play and please do share this page with anyone you might think would be interested in helping us or coming to see the show!
Please follow us on social media :)
Twitter: @BlueButterflyPr
Instagram: @preciouslittletalent
Facebook: @preciouslittletalentcourtyardtheatre
We promise to keep you up to date every step of the way...
Thanks again! 
Grace, Brock, Marta, Fran and rest of the Precious Little Talent team x

story:
"Amor mio"

E’la storia di un en travestì che sta per avere il suo debutto che vi racconteremo.

Un camerino, un palco, un pubblico in febbrile attesa: tra poco “il travestito” di cui tutta la città parla si esibirà. Un momento di divertimento per un pubblico eterogeneo che, nonostante il vento di libertà che spira in quegli anni ’70, si diverte al doppiogiochismo dell’ambiguità.

Del resto tutto è ambiguo nell'Italia anni ’70, in pieno fermento multiculturale, intriso di spirito di libertà, di trasgressione, di lotte politiche, libertà nei costumi, nei colori, nelle mode.

E non è tutto le donne diventano protagoniste complice il movimento di liberazione delle donne.

Un vento di novità che soffia attraverso la musica non solo made in USA ma anche quella che accompagna lo scorrere di chi è giovane in quel crocevia della storia: Battisti, Mina, Aznavour…

Mentre il mondo cambia, lui “il travestito” continua a vivere il doloroso dramma dell’esclusione, lui il marginale della storia e della vita. Quel palco, l’apertura di quel sipario appaiono come la sua possibilità. L’unica, forse l’ultima. Con lui una giovane donna, una francese che è la sua forza e un’ombra la madre con un carico di insopportabile dolore.

Un travestito, un essere umano in perenne apprendimento esistenziale, disperato equilibrismo di cuore e sentimenti, sempre in bilico tra il rifiuto e la precaria accettazione, una ricerca disperata di radici, in un continuo doloroso chiedersi il senso di quella vita che pure deve vivere, giorno dopo giorno, testa alta e cera nelle orecchie come Ulisse. Ma le Sirene che lo circondano non cantano amore e non intrecciano trame di reti nelle quali sarebbe dolce perdersi e addormentarsi come in un grembo di madre. Quelle Sirene non vivono il gioco di una sessualità negata, ma gridano e sputano veleno, deturpando nel profondo chi la sua vita in tacchi a spillo e abiti scintillanti vorrebbe solo viverla, sulla scena e in disparte. Una intima, profonda, incorrotta innocenza violata dal fango di chi si arroga la normalità: il solito vecchio scandalo della storia che si ripete da diecimila anni.

Uno scandalo che il travestito, conosce, indifeso: l’abbandono e il tradimento, il peggiore, quello che sua madre scrive sulla sua pelle bambina con la punta di un pennino che intinge nell'inchiostro nero e denso del rifiuto. Con quell'inchiostro al veleno lui scrive un doloroso amore: in un intreccio fra gioco, travestimento e ricerca di affettività. Il rifiuto di una donna troverà, forse,compensazione nella accettazione piena e incondizionata dell’altra donna.

Maria Laura Platania

La Mission

Raccontare storie e in specie storie di esclusione è la nostra vocazione, raccontarle in un continuo contrappunto musicale quasi d’obbligo, perché ogni vita ha un suo leit motive. Ogni storia il suo intimo mai completamente svelato perché.

Abbiamo cominciato la nostra trilogia con “Antonietta e Gabriele”, storia di una esclusione di due anime diverse eppure tanto simili nella Roma degli anni ’30, continuiamo ora con “Amor mio” gli anni sono i ’70, ma l’accettazione della diversità è ancora difficile. Oggi il mondo se non è il migliore dei mondi possibili, è un mondo che sia pure a stento e fatica, affrontando ostacoli e improvvise inversioni di rotta, si avvia ad essere migliore. Noi vogliamo che lo sia e utilizziamo i nostri ferri del mestiere per collaborare a questa costruzione.

Interpreti

Alla grintosa coppia costituita dai ben noti cantattori Simone Sibillano e Brunella Platania si unisce la talentuosa performer Chiara Di Bari.

L’ideazione e la regia sono dello stesso Simone Sibillano

Simone Sibillano

Nel 1998 si diploma all’Istituto Statale d’Arte Sacra per l’Arredamento e la Decorazione della Chiesa.Dal 1996 al 1998 studia canto lirico con il baritono R. Piemontese e nel frattempo frequenta corsi di danza moderna, jazz e latina e un corso di recitazione con il regista G. Nardoni.

ESPERIENZE LAVORATIVE

2017 Scrive interpreta e dirige "Antonietta e Gabriele"

2015-2016 Production singer presso Costa Crociere

2015 dirige e interpreta il musical “Il primo Papa” sulla vita di San Pietro, nel ruolo del protagonista

2015 interpreta Amore nel Musical “Amore e Psiche” per la regia di Giovanni Nardoni.

2015 Scrive il musical “Le sorelle Frank” liberamente ispirato al Diario di Anna Frank. E ne cura la regia

2014 Scrive e interpreta il musical “Cercasi Violetta” per la regia di Marco Simeoli

2013 Interpreta il ruolo di Tommaso nella commedia musicale "Raffaello e la leggenda della Fornarina" di Giancarlo Acquisti per la regia di Marcello Sindici

2013 Scrive e dirige il musical “America” interpretando il ruolo di Bartolomeo Cataldo

2012-2013 interpreta il ruolo del cacciatore nel musical “Biancaneve”

2010-2011-2012 é Jafar nel musical “Aladin” di Stefano D'orazio musiche dei Pooh per la regia di Fabrizio angelini.Svolge per lo show un' attivita di vocal coach.

2009-2010-2011 è Paolo il fariseo nella opera-musical "Wojtila generation" con concerti in Polonia e Spagna.

2010 interpreta il ruolo di Karol Wojtila nel musical “Non abbiate paura- Giovanni Paolo II il grande” per la regia di Gianluca ferrato.

2008-2009-2010 è impegnato nella tourneè del musical “Robin Hood” di B. Dati nel ruolo dello sceriffo di Notthingam Guyo Tristan per la regia di C. Ginepro.

2007 è nel musical “Il principe della gioventù” di R. Ortolani per la regia di P. L. Pizzi nel ruolo di Franceschino

2006-2007-2008 interpreta il ruolo di Jesus nel musical in versione italiana “Jesus Christ Superstar” di Webber – Rice per la regia di F. Angelini

2005-2006 è Raoul ne "Il fantasma dell’opera" per la regia di A. De la Roche.

2004 è nel musical "Boccadoro the traveller” per la regia di F.Angelini nel ruolo di Boccadoro.

2003 interpreta il ruolo dell’evangelista nel musical "Per sempre mio divino amore" e il uolo dell’angelo nel musical "Quando cantano le ali", entrambi per la regia di L. Cognatti.

2003 lavora come cantante solista-ballerino nella produzione Rai "Casaraiuno" per le coreografie di F. Miseria.

2002 è nel musical “Il ritratto di Dorian Gray” di T. Russo, nel ruolo di Adrian Singleton e come cover di Dorian Gray, James Vane e Alan Campbell.

2001 entra a far parte del musical “I Promessi Sposi” di T. Russo.

2000 viene scritturato da M. Ranieri per il musical “Il grande campione” di M. Fabrizio e G. Morra per la regia di G. P. Griffi.

1999 Debutta in teatro due anni dopo come cantante-attore al fianco di N. Castelnuovo nella tragedia musicale "Elena" di Euripide per la regia di G. Nardoni.

1997 lavora come cantante solista nella produzione Mediaset “Sarabanda”.

PREMI

2014 vince il premio Broadwayworld.com per la categoria miglior attore protagonista

per l'interpretazione di Batolomeo Cataldo nel musical “America”.

Brunella Platania

Cantante, attrice e doppiatrice.
Nel 2017 è Vi Moore nel musical "Footloose" della Stage Entertainment e nello stesso anno debutta al fianco di Simone Sibillano in "Antonietta e Gabriele" nel ruolo di Antonietta
 Brunella Platania, interpreta,nell’ambito del musical, il ruolo di Sidonia e Tosca in “Tosca Amore Disperato” di L. Dalla e D. Zard, Maddalena in “Jesus Christ Superstar” della Compagnia della Rancia, diretta da F. Angelini, prima Perpetua poi Agnese ne “I Promessi Sposi” di M. Guardì, Fornarina in “Raffaello e la Leggenda della Fornarina” di G.Acquisti, diretta da M. Sindici, Ortensia in “Aggiungi un Posto a Tavola”, diretta da F. Angelini, Malfiore in “Wojtyla Generation - Love Rock Musical” di R. Avallone, Adriana in “Trasteverini, Sotto il cielo di Roma” di G. Vergoni e A. Perrozzi,diretta Angelini, Ambra in “E non finisce mica il cielo” di G. Vergoni, sempre per la regia di Angelini, la Signora Otis in “Canterville” di Robert Steiner , regia M. Simeoli, Lady Rose in “Robin Hood , il valore della giustizia” di S.Martino, regia di P. Gatti. In tetaro è stata protagonista di:  “Opinioni di un Clown in si bemolle”di Heinrich Boll , regia di S. De Luca e M.L. Platania; “ Tutti al macello!” di B. Vian, regia di A.Cervigni; ”La Torta di Joe” di E Tulli, regia di S. Mastrosimone e G. Matruonola. Porta in scena, con la compagnia “Le tempe d’un pause”, gli spettacoli  “Lovers, -Amanti”, “Una stranissima ragazza” e “Chocolat” e “Piccole Donne “con la regia di M.L. Platania. Nel Maggio 2015 la vediamo come regista associata, acting e vocal coach nel nuovo allestimento di “Jesus Christ Superstar” della “Compagnia della Croce del Sud”, dove ha l’opportunità di lavorare a fianco del performer di fama internazionale Steve Balsamo (“Jesus” nel West End); nella ripresa del 2016 interpreterà la Maddalena nelle Special Cast. Si cimenta ancora nella regia nel giugno 2015, insieme a M. Sindici e M.L. Platania, in “Sogno di una notte di mezza estate” versione musical al Teatro Sala Umberto di Roma, ripreso poi a Macerata al Lauro Rossi accanto a R. Rossetti. Nel Maggio 2016 in  "Georgie il musical" dove, oltre ad interpretare Mary Buttman, Brunella è vocal coach e casting director .Nel doppiaggio ha dato la voce “cantante” alla dottoressa Bailey nella puntata musical di “Grey’s Anatomy” e a diversi personaggi di cartoni animati della Fox e della Disney con cui collabora sotto la direzione del maestro Ernesto Brancucci. Deve la sua preparazione a grandi maestri quali Pino Manzari, Claretta Carotenuto, T. Zinzi e G. De Feo e in quello musicale e del canto a L. Vella, P.Bonfrati, Luca Velletri, M. Fontana, P. Neri e al grande Carl Anderson. È direttrice dell’Accademia Platafisica di Macerata e dell’accademia Professione Spettacolo di Roma, e del corso di canto e interpretazione del MIP di Chiara Noschese.

Chiara Di Bari

Cantante e attrice porta avanti il suo lavoro tra Francia, Italia e diversi paesi dell’est come la Russia, l’Ukraina, la Corea, il Taiwan, Singapore e il Giappone. Tra il 1995 e il 1998 lavora con diversi registi su spettacoli teatrali di autori come Sofocle, Euripide, Shakespeare, Beckett e Guardigli. Dal 1999 al 2000 é cantane e percussionista in « CANTI DI SCENA » di e con Vincenzo Cerami e Nicola Piovani (Oscar per « La vita é bella »). A partire dal 2002 Interpreta il ruolo di Esmeralda e Fiordaliso nella versione italiana di « NOTRE DAME DE PARIS » di Riccardo Cocciante, Luc Plamondon e Pasquale Panella. Nel 2005 il produttore francese del musical, Nicolas Talar, la sceglie per far parte del cast internazionale in tourné in Corea, Taiwan e Singapore. Tra il 2007 e il 2008 interpreta il ruolo di Mercedes ne « IL CONTE DI MONTECRISTO » di Robert Steiner e Francesco marchetti per la regia di Gino Landi e Jocelyn e il ruolo dell’indemoniata in « ACTOR DEI » produzione musicale prodotta dal Vaticano e inspirata alla vita di Padre Pio. Nel 2008 debutta ne «  LA STRADA » , versione teatrale e musicale del film di Federico Fellini accanto a Tosca e Massimo Venturiello, con musiche di Germano Mazzocchetti.  A partire dal 2009 interpreta il ruolo principale in diverse produzioni musicali e di prosa in Francia : « LA PETITE SIRENE » di Christian Schittenhelm, « HAIR » per la regia di Ned Grudjic, « 80 JOURS, UN PARI EST UN PARI » di Marie Jo Zarb, « IL ETAIT UNE FOIS JOE DASSIN » con la regia di Christophe Barratier (Les choristes) con cui gira l’Europa per due anni. Seguono trasmissioni televisive come « FASILA CHANTER » e spot pubblicitari per PANZANI. Seguono « LA BELLE AU BOIS DORMANT QUE VEILLENT LE FÉES », «  POIL DE CAROTTE » , « JONAS » «TOBIE & SARRA » « L’HOMME DE LA MANCHA », «  OTHELLO ».

 

Nel 2015 torna in Italia per il musical di Simone Sibillano e Guido Cataldo «AMERICA » e per «  AMORE & PSICHE » di Giovanni Nardoni .

 

Nel settembre 2016 é l’interprete, insieme a Laurent Ban, di «  LELOUCHE EN MUSIQUE » Cine-concerto e spettacolo omaggio di Elie Chouraqui, prodotto da Opera en Plein Air con l’orchestra sinfonica di Tokyo, all’Osaka festival Hall di Osaka e al NHK Hall di Tokyo.

 

Nel novembre 2016 é una degli interpreti del grande Concerto «  3 HEURES A PARIS » accanto a Bruno Pelletier, Luck Mervil, Natasha Saint Pierre, Matt Laurent, Cecilia Cara, Mikelangelo Loconte, Laurent Ban e Solal al Cremlino a Mosca e anche a Kiev, Odessa e Saint Petersbourg.

 

Nel 2017 é stata in scena al théâtre des Blancs Manteaux a Parigi in « EINSTEIN, UN BABYSITTING EXPLOSIF » e in tournée con «  LA FETE DE LA CHANSON FRANCAISE » et « SOUVENIR SOUVENIR » scritto e diretto da Gregory Benchenafi.

2001 entra a far parte del musical “I Promessi Sposi” di T. Russo.
2000 viene scritturato da M. Ranieri per il musical “Il grande campione” di M. Fabrizio e G. Morra per la regia di G. P. Griffi.
1999 Debutta in teatro due anni dopo come cantante-attore al fianco di N. Castelnuovo nella tragedia musicale "Elena" di Euripide per la regia di G. Nardoni.
1997 lavora come cantante solista nella produzione Mediaset “Sarabanda”.
PREMI
2014 vince il premio Broadwayworld.com per la categoria miglior attore protagonista
per l'interpretazione di Batolomeo Cataldo nel musical “America”.
Brunella Platania
Cantante, attrice e doppiatrice.Nel 2017 è Vi Moore nel musical "Footloose" della Stage Entertainment e nello stesso anno debutta al fianco di Simone Sibillano in "Antonietta e Gabriele" nel ruolo di Antonietta Brunella Platania, interpreta,nell’ambito del musical, il ruolo di Sidonia e Tosca in “Tosca Amore Disperato” di L. Dalla e D. Zard, Maddalena in “Jesus Christ Superstar” della Compagnia della Rancia, diretta da F. Angelini, prima Perpetua poi Agnese ne “I Promessi Sposi” di M. Guardì, Fornarina in “Raffaello e la Leggenda della Fornarina” di G.Acquisti, diretta da M. Sindici, Ortensia in “Aggiungi un Posto a Tavola”, diretta da F. Angelini, Malfiore in “Wojtyla Generation - Love Rock Musical” di R. Avallone, Adriana in “Trasteverini, Sotto il cielo di Roma” di G. Vergoni e A. Perrozzi,diretta Angelini, Ambra in “E non finisce mica il cielo” di G. Vergoni, sempre per la regia di Angelini, la Signora Otis in “Canterville” di Robert Steiner , regia M. Simeoli, Lady Rose in “Robin Hood , il valore della giustizia” di S.Martino, regia di P. Gatti. In tetaro è stata protagonista di:  “Opinioni di un Clown in si bemolle”di Heinrich Boll , regia di S. De Luca e M.L. Platania; “ Tutti al macello!” di B. Vian, regia di A.Cervigni; ”La Torta di Joe” di E Tulli, regia di S. Mastrosimone e G. Matruonola. Porta in scena, con la compagnia “Le tempe d’un pause”, gli spettacoli  “Lovers, -Amanti”, “Una stranissima ragazza” e “Chocolat” e “Piccole Donne “con la regia di M.L. Platania. Nel Maggio 2015 la vediamo come regista associata, acting e vocal coach nel nuovo allestimento di “Jesus Christ Superstar” della “Compagnia della Croce del Sud”, dove ha l’opportunità di lavorare a fianco del performer di fama internazionale Steve Balsamo (“Jesus” nel West End); nella ripresa del 2016 interpreterà la Maddalena nelle Special Cast. Si cimenta ancora nella regia nel giugno 2015, insieme a M. Sindici e M.L. Platania, in “Sogno di una notte di mezza estate” versione musical al Teatro Sala Umberto di Roma, ripreso poi a Macerata al Lauro Rossi accanto a R. Rossetti. Nel Maggio 2016 in  "Georgie il musical" dove, oltre ad interpretare Mary Buttman, Brunella è vocal coach e casting director .Nel doppiaggio ha dato la voce “cantante” alla dottoressa Bailey nella puntata musical di “Grey’s Anatomy” e a diversi personaggi di cartoni animati della Fox e della Disney con cui collabora sotto la direzione del maestro Ernesto Brancucci. Deve la sua preparazione a grandi maestri quali Pino Manzari, Claretta Carotenuto, T. Zinzi e G. De Feo e in quello musicale e del canto a L. Vella, P.Bonfrati, Luca Velletri, M. Fontana, P. Neri e al grande Carl Anderson. È direttrice dell’Accademia Platafisica di Macerata e dell’accademia Professione Spettacolo di Roma, e del corso di canto e interpretazione del MIP di Chiara Noschese.
Chiara Di Bari
Cantante e attrice porta avanti il suo lavoro tra Francia, Italia e diversi paesi dell’est come la Russia, l’Ukraina, la Corea, il Taiwan, Singapore e il Giappone. Tra il 1995 e il 1998 lavora con diversi registi su spettacoli teatrali di autori come Sofocle, Euripide, Shakespeare, Beckett e Guardigli. Dal 1999 al 2000 é cantane e percussionista in « CANTI DI SCENA » di e con Vincenzo Cerami e Nicola Piovani (Oscar per « La vita é bella »). A partire dal 2002 Interpreta il ruolo di Esmeralda e Fiordaliso nella versione italiana di « NOTRE DAME DE PARIS » di Riccardo Cocciante, Luc Plamondon e Pasquale Panella. Nel 2005 il produttore francese del musical, Nicolas Talar, la sceglie per far parte del cast internazionale in tourné in Corea, Taiwan e Singapore. Tra il 2007 e il 2008 interpreta il ruolo di Mercedes ne « IL CONTE DI MONTECRISTO » di Robert Steiner e Francesco marchetti per la regia di Gino Landi e Jocelyn e il ruolo dell’indemoniata in « ACTOR DEI » produzione musicale prodotta dal Vaticano e inspirata alla vita di Padre Pio. Nel 2008 debutta ne «  LA STRADA » , versione teatrale e musicale del film di Federico Fellini accanto a Tosca e Massimo Venturiello, con musiche di Germano Mazzocchetti.  A partire dal 2009 interpreta il ruolo principale in diverse produzioni musicali e di prosa in Francia : « LA PETITE SIRENE » di Christian Schittenhelm, « HAIR » per la regia di Ned Grudjic, « 80 JOURS, UN PARI EST UN PARI » di Marie Jo Zarb, « IL ETAIT UNE FOIS JOE DASSIN » con la regia di Christophe Barratier (Les choristes) con cui gira l’Europa per due anni. Seguono trasmissioni televisive come « FASILA CHANTER » e spot pubblicitari per PANZANI. Seguono « LA BELLE AU BOIS DORMANT QUE VEILLENT LE FÉES », «  POIL DE CAROTTE » , « JONAS » «TOBIE & SARRA » « L’HOMME DE LA MANCHA », «  OTHELLO ».
 
Nel 2015 torna in Italia per il musical di Simone Sibillano e Guido Cataldo «AMERICA » e per «  AMORE & PSICHE » di Giovanni Nardoni .
 
Nel settembre 2016 é l’interprete, insieme a Laurent Ban, di «  LELOUCHE EN MUSIQUE » Cine-concerto e spettacolo omaggio di Elie Chouraqui, prodotto da Opera en Plein Air con l’orchestra sinfonica di Tokyo, all’Osaka festival Hall di Osaka e al NHK Hall di Tokyo.
 
Nel novembre 2016 é una degli interpreti del grande Concerto «  3 HEURES A PARIS » accanto a Bruno Pelletier, Luck Mervil, Natasha Saint Pierre, Matt Laurent, Cecilia Cara, Mikelangelo Loconte, Laurent Ban e Solal al Cremlino a Mosca e anche a Kiev, Odessa e Saint Petersbourg.
 
Nel 2017 é stata in scena al théâtre des Blancs Manteaux a Parigi in « EINSTEIN, UN BABYSITTING EXPLOSIF » e in tournée con «  LA FETE DE LA CHANSON FRANCAISE » et « SOUVENIR SOUVENIR » scritto e diretto da Gregory Benchenafi.
campaign_city: ALTRO SPAZIO Via Tiburno 30 Roma, Italy

story:
PLEASE SUPPORT FIRST LADIES PROJECT EXCITING SEPTEMBER 2011 RUN!

Since our last successful run at New York Theater Workshop this April, First Ladies Project has been offered the exciting opportunity to be presented by the Playwrights Horizons Theater School Festival, THE COOKERY. The plays chosen for THE COOKERY are selected based on the recommendation of faculty and staff at Playwrights Horizons Theater School.


First Ladies Project dives deep into 1776’s America with Martha Washington and resurfaces with Michelle Obama, coursing through the White House and unearthing the stories of this entirely American and oft-forgotten sorority. The tour is lead by an ensemble cast of five bright, earnest, unapologetic and deeply devoted women in classic period undergarments who inhabit the styles and hair-shapes of the First Ladies to resuscitate their memories and bring this truly electric hallway of portraits to life.

Who Are You Supporting?

The Play was Collaboratively Written by and Starring- 

Kim Blanck, Dana Clinkman, Claire Downs, Annie Tippe, and Ryann Weir


Our team also includes Eric Mercado, Eleot Reich, Rachel Schneider, Eric Biel, and Kaela Garvin


How Will My Contribution Help?
If you supported our last run, WE THANK YOU IMMENSELY! Your gifts helped us secure our most recent run, which will be attended by many members of the theater community! This run will hopefully provide new opportunities to be produced by additional organizations, and provide new performing and directing opportunities for all of our members!

$10 provides a few yards of fabric

$20 provides a prop or costume piece

$40 provides one wig

$50 provides a pile of lumber for the set

$100 provides a rental van for our load-in; Administrative costs for mailing; One full costume rental from the Costume Collection; Etc! Etc!

How Can I See The Show?

Shows take place at the Bob Moss Theater, 3rd fl, 440 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10003

Performances take place on:
September 15th @ 7pm
September 16th @ 9pm
September 17th @ 7pm
September 18th @ 3pm

Tickets are $10 and can be purchased by going to www.phtschool.org/thecookery. For more information please visit www.firstladiesproject.com.

story:
TACT is crazy, wild, drama/comedy that takes place on the eve of 2012. Presented by the Manhattan Theater Rep in early November. This is going to be VERY fun and exciting-but we need your help! Donations go towards rehearsal space, props, etc.

On the eve of the coming apocalypse, Max enters a store with gun-from then on, nothing will be the same.

 

According to the Mayan calendar, there are only a few hours left on earth. The outside world is chaos. Crime levels have shot up. People are preparing for the end. In the midst of it all, Max is determined to have the perfect date with Gaia-a troubled young woman. His pot-smoking grandmother, sex offender brother, and his underage girlfriend are along for the ride. They try to make the best of what may be their last moments. A play about trying to stay sane when the rest of the world has feed into insanity, and learning to let love in.

Written by Jan Rosenberg and directed by Courtney Wetzel. 


Starring:

Bill Bria

Madalyn Pedone

Regina Yeager

Judy Merrick

Valerie Terranova


rest TBA!


Even the tiniest bit of funding will get you thanked in the program-and possibly even reserved seating, if you're lucky.

If you love to support the arts and new work, help TACT get off its feet!

story:
WHAT IS RECONSTRUCTION?

Reconstruction is a play about a young woman named Sylvia who comes to grips with her father’s death through the help of her best friend- Abraham Lincoln. What better way to explore daddy issues than with one of the countries greatest fore-fathers? Life is one great anecdote with Lincoln as a roommate, until Syliva must chose between her fantasy world, and the reality of her father’s suicide. Laughs, tears, battle scenes- Reconstruction follows these two individuals as they attempt to rebuild their lives after their loss.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

We're producing the play at the Hollywood Fringe Festival this June and need $4,000 dollars! What does this go twoards this you ask? 

- Theater rental (it ain't cheap, one night's rental is about $200!)

- Set (we're furnishing an apartment set, from the windows to the walls!)

- Costume (do you want a Presidential suit? Or a clip on tie and bermuda shorts?)

- Props (we can mime everything if you want us to... please don't make us)

- Marketing (and in this day and age, its ALL about marketing!)

Check out our list of awesome perks to see what you'll recieve per level of  donation! No donation is too small! Even pennies carry the Lincoln stamp of approval!

 

A LITTLE MORE ABOUT US...

Reconstruction began as a staged reading in the 2010 Occidental College New Play Festival. This June will be its premier as a fully staged piece- and what better place to premier than the Hollywood Fringe Festival! The festival is a full 10 days of Theater that ranges from Shakespeare on a procenium stage to burlesque on a playground! Sadly our play does not involve any burlesque or playgrounds- but it does include a fabulous production team of four young artists working in Los angeles:

Alyssa Escalante:

Alyssa has worked since 2010 as a professional stage manager and will be co-producing Reconstruction.

Claudia Gomez-Restrepo: 

Claudia is a working actress and writer, and the author of Reconstruction. She has participated in the Fringe since it's begining- and this year joins the festival as a writer.

Kaja Martin:

Kaja has produced many of her own works since 2008- she will act as director and co-producer of Reconstruction.

Courtney Dusenberry:

Courtney is a talented scenic designer and painter. She joins the team as a co-producer and set designer. 

 

WHAT YOUR SUPPORT MEANS

Through your contribution you are directly supporting the professional growth, and artistic exploration of these four artists, we can't thank you enough!

You are also supporting the Hollywood Fringe Festival, which means you are continuting the tradition of theater in Los Angeles! All participating artists owe you thanks as well!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

Like us on Facebook! We will keep you updated on our progress!

Share it with your friends! ALL your friends! : )

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Reconstruction-2012/188378064600242

Check out our project page on the Hollywood Fringe Festival website, where you can find dates and ticket prices- also pre order your tickets : )

http://www.hollywoodfringe.org/projects/783

MORE HELP-

You donated and you STILL want to help? Great! We have a few ways you can volunteer- such as running the box office or assiting in prop collection and set building! Contact us for more info at reconstruction2012@gmail.com !

story:
HELP US CELEBRATE PEPATIAN’s 30th ANNIVERSARY BY MAKING A CONTRIBUTION IN SUPPORT OF OUR UPCOMING PROJECTS!   www.pepatian.org

2013 Projects include:
 
1)  SHADOW LANDS  -  dance theater collaboration with artists CARIDAD DE LA LUZ/LA BRUJA and CYNTHIA PANIAGUA will premiere at Pregones Theater, June 15, 2013.   Directorial Consultant: Teresa Hernandez (USArtist Fellow, Theater).
 
2)   BRONX HIP-HOP ACADEMY - workshops for teens at BronxWorks by acclaimed teaching artists: ROKAFELLA (Dance), LA BRUJA (Spoken Word), TOOFLY (Visual Art) and CHI SALAAM (Music).

3)  HUNTS POINT HOMES - a new collaborative project with HATUEY RAMOS FERMIN, choreographers/dancers: ALICIA DIAZ, MATTHEW THORNTON, MARION RAMIREZ, JUNG WOONG KIM. The work will focus on Hunts Point with an informal showing of work at BAAD!  May 2013.

4) OUT OF LA NEGRURA/OUT OF BLACKNESS – a documentary film project that focuses on creative process with artists: Sita Frederick, Rokafella, and Marion Ramirez. Editor: Naeema Jamilah.  We plan to send to festivals!

 

We aim to raise $2500 for Pepatian Spring 2013 events – the money will be distributed to all four projects and help cover expenses like video documentation, marketing costs, office supplies, technical support.

 

WHAT YOU GET:

Credit on Pepatian Spring 2013 programs

Free tickets to Pepatian Spring 2013 performances

Free Pepatian t-shirts

Opportunity to meet with Pepatian staff and the artists.

Credit on Pepatian website

!!! THANK YOU GRACIAS THANKS!!!

Please share this call for support with your friends and supporters - we appreciate your help!   

We look forward to seeing you at the Spring performances!

story:
Who are we?

The Arc of Kitsap & Jefferson Counties (The Arc) works to provide education, advocacy, and support to people living with Intellectual and Developmental disabilities (ID/DD) such as Autism, Cerebral Palsy, and Downs Syndrome, to have whole and successful lives in the community. The Arc also provides advocacy and support for the families, other loved ones, and care providers, in the work it does providing programs, services, and connection to community members and government agencies.

 

What’s happening?

The Friday Night Social or “the dance” is one of the Arc’s most beloved programs since 1978, and strives to increase social skills, meaningful participation, and self-determination, all in a recreational opportunity. It is an evening where community comes together, in a safe environment, to have fun, meet friends, and of course dance.

Since its founding in 1938, The Arc has gone through a number of changes. Due to a number of factors, including the economic downturn of the past few years, we have had to look at the realities of reorganization, needs for fundraising, and the options for scaling back or completely shutting down some of the Arc’s important programs; one of those is the dance.

 

What can you do to help?

Plain and simple, donate to save the dance! Direct costs for the dance are over $25,000 a year. That includes paying for a minimum of staff to oversee the dancing, socializing, and serving of food and drink. All the while ensuring everyone is safe and of course having a good time. It also includes the pizza, drinks, snacks, and once a month, birthday cake.

This of course does not represent the costs to provide a facility that can handle 150 to 300 participants and care givers, the overhead of providing communication and administration of the program, and other supporting expenses.

 

Can I do anything else to help?

We would love for you to share this with your family, friends, and coworkers. We make it easy, using the buttons below for FaceBook, and soon Twitter!

Our thanks to you for your time and donation!

Don’t let this be their last dance!

 

 

How to make your donation:

  • Select “Contribute Now”
  • Fill in the Billing / Shipping Information, whether you want to have your vote      (donation) listed on the donation page, optionally provide a comment,      optionally sign up for future emails regarding fundraisers, and select      your payment type.
  • Select payment via the Indiegogo site or through PayPal
  • Follow the prompts to provide your billing information – see note below for more information

Please note –

If you pay by credit/debit card on the Indiegogo site, it will not be eligible for a tax donation

  • The Arc is a      501(c) 3 organization, and your donation through PayPal may be tax deductible outside of any direct benefit(s) received.
  • PayPal will ask you to login or create a PayPal account, but you can contribute to a campaign via PayPal, even if you do not have a PayPal account. Use your credit card to "Pay as a Guest" without signing in:
    • When you get to the PayPal screen, you'll see up top "Choose a Way to Pay"
    • Select the second option: "Pay with a debit or credit card"
    • Complete the form - PayPal accepts Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express
    • Deselect/uncheck the checkbox that says: "Save this information with a PayPal account"
    • Click "Review and Continue" to continue with a payment using a credit card
    • Click on the "Continue Without Logging In" link

If you pay by credit/debit card on the Indiegogo site, it will not be eligible for a tax donation

The Arc is a      501(c) 3 organization, and your donation through PayPal may be tax deductible outside of any direct benefit(s) received.
PayPal will ask you to login or create a PayPal account, but you can contribute to a campaign via PayPal, even if you do not have a PayPal account. Use your credit card to "Pay as a Guest" without signing in:

When you get to the PayPal screen, you'll see up top "Choose a Way to Pay"
Select the second option: "Pay with a debit or credit card"
Complete the form - PayPal accepts Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express
Deselect/uncheck the checkbox that says: "Save this information with a PayPal account"
Click "Review and Continue" to continue with a payment using a credit card
Click on the "Continue Without Logging In" link

story:
Short Summary

MANish BOY is my latest project and one-man show and because of it's impact, I feel this story should reach men nationally and internationally. After hearing young men saying they were inspired and wished to reconnect with their fathers as a result of seeing MANish BOY live, it was clear to me that my story, which is as humorous as it is moving, needs to effect even more lives than it has.

MANish BOY is about my life and the people who've brought me to where I am today. You've met a few of them over the years in my comedy, but you've not seen them like this, altogether, seamlessly transitioning before you, at one time.

Additionally, laughter is a medicine that we all need to take and bringing MANish BOY to cities throughout the US can help me do my part to help America lighten up and laugh a little bit. Well, my goal is to help them LAUGH A LOT!:

  • I'm an actor and comedian and have been making people laugh on television and in film for over 20 years. You may have seen me on television on my own show called On Our Own, Seinfeld, In Living Color, Living Single and in the star-studded film, Dreamgirls and on TVOne hosting My Momma Throws Down.
  • This fundraising campaign will help bring my NAACP Theater Award nominated production, and all my characters, to more audiences for additional runs. We've done it before, but if it's changing lives, why stop now?
  • Each of your contributions will make it possible to offset production costs for the next run from October 12-November 4 in Los Angeles. Every little bit counts and every contribution is an expression of love for both me, what I'm doing to give back, and is abundantly appreciated. (I'm on my knees thanking you already!)

How $25K can help change boys to men

It may just be a small start, but it's a powerful one.

I'm raising $25,000 in funding for this production. This includes all expenses and promotions, bringing awareness to the show and making comped tickets available for Non-Profit organizations that mentor young men.

What you get in return is memorabilia, your name or business acknowleged for everybody to see (and we have a lot of people coming!), and some will take away t-shirts, show tickets, and promotional advertising.

I've set up this campaign so that whatever we do raise, (I'm saying "we" because "WE" as a family will do this) will be used to offset cost. All contributions will be used for the production, and your perks will be processed as soon as the production closes November 4, 2012.

 

With several thousand friends and followers, all can contribute from $20 to 1 million if it strikes YOU! OK... Just Kidding. But if you can give between $100 to $2500 that'll insure that we can reach our ultimate goal of 25K. I'm humbled by each and every donation and grateful already that you've taken the time to acknowledge this campaign by reading this and considering a donation.

How this affects folks

When's the last time you laughed and cried at the same performance? If not today, your contribution can bring moving experience like this to YOU and those who benefit from seeing the show. So, Come and Join Me...

In the previous three runs, in Los Angeles and Charlotte, we sold out shows and on the nights we didn't sell out we were close to it. Some came back night after night to see the show. Which is proof MANish BOY needs to be seen at least once by you and someone you know.

 

We would appreciate you spreading the word about MANish BOY

You can give in several ways, monetarily or share a laugh by forwarding this campaign and the attached videos. Somebody you know may need this experience. So... Give them something to smile about!

If you're on Twitter and Facebook or even Pinterest, share this like it's going out of style. 

LET'S DO THIS! Contribute what you can and we'll reach our goal in no time!

story:
My name is Kelly Nieto and I am the creator, songwriter, and producer of The Cross and the Light, an acclaimed musical dramatization of the Passion, Death and Resurrection of Christ. This extraordinary stage production has been described as the “Broadway version of the ‘Passion of Christ’” because of its original musical score, special effects, and high-caliber actors. The Cross and The Light will make its debut at the iconic Music Hall Center for the Performing Arts in Detroit for 11 performances from Sunday, March 24 to Easter Sunday, March 31, 2013.

Why IndieGoGo?

I know that hundreds of people at Music Hall will want to purchase The Cross and the Light CD. Unfortunately, we do not have the funds to record a CD prior to our performance dates. That’s why we have created The Cross and the Light IndieGoGo Campaign!

Help us fund our LIVE CD from Music Hall this year!

Moving to a professional theater is a serious financial undertaking for our new production company. In addition to raising five children, my husband and I have personally funded the majority of this project since 2002. Thanks to a handful of generous donors we have been able to move to Music Hall, but we need financial assistance on this project. 

So I'm asking YOU for help!

If we can get 280 people to purchase a CD in advance for only $25, we can create “The Cross and the Light - LIVE CD from Music Hall” this year!

As an added bonus for your help, your CD will be personally autographed by Kenny Watson, the man playing the role of “Jesus”, and Kelly Nieto, the creator and songwriter of The Cross and the Light.

We only need to pre-sell 280 CDs during our campaign!

Once you hear the music and our amazing singers, you're going to want to purchase the CD! To hear some of the new songs from Act 2 click here.

It's Great Music and a Powerful Prayer!

The Cross and the Light is not only about great music, it's a great prayer; a prayer that should be prayed all throughout the year, not just during Lent. So why not purchase the CD today. If you're like me and always looking for ways to evangelize to friends and family, purchase 2 or more CDs today and give them away as gifts! It's a great way to evangelize!

If you can afford to pledge more than $25, we have lots of extra perks. Please see the Perks on the right side of the screen for more information. 

CD Cost Breakdown

Here is the cost breakdown for creating the CD:

  • $750 Digitally Record 4 live shows at Music Hall
  • $4500 Mix and Master the recordings
  • $500 Artwork
  • $1250 Duplication

Impact on our Community

It is impossible to put a price on the spiritual impact of The Cross and the Light. For many, it is a spiritual wake-up call; a visual realization of what Christ went through on the Cross. This deeply moving musical production brings people to the foot of the cross to experience Jesus’ final hours in a way that becomes a personal and profound encounter with our Savior. It is a life changing experience.

 

  “...amazing! It really made me feel like I was there during Jesus’ time, experiencing the passion of Christ.”

    -Kersten Everest Collegiate 9th Grader

 “When I was in college I saw Godspell and it stayed with me for months. (This) will be with me forever!” 

            -2011 Audience Member

“It’s a spiritual wake-up call!"

            -Brian Koziara, College student

“This powerful prayer brought both my husband and I back to the church after 50 years!”

            -Kathy, 2012 Audience Member

 “Fantastic performance…Broadway quality!”

            -Jack Krasula, WJR Radio Host of “Anything is Possible”

“It’s Les Mis in Jerusalem!”

            -Teresa Tomeo, Nationally syndicated Radio Host

“(this production) promises to draw countless people closer to Jesus, knowing His love more clearly, understanding His sacrifice more deeply, and becoming more ready to share the Good News of His love with others.”

            -The Most Reverend Allen H. Vigneron Archbishop of Detroit­

A vision from God that changed my life and thousands of others!

The Cross and the Light is a “vision” that God put on my heart while praying the Stations of the Cross for the first time on Good Friday in 2000. I had ever been in a church on a Good Friday, let alone prayed this prayer. By the 6th Station, I was overwhelmed with grief and spiritual pain. When I looked at the altar, I saw The Cross and the Light and heard God’s voice say, “This is why you are here!” I knew I had been CALLED for this work, but didn’t know how I could ever make it happen. For more details about Kelly's personal testimony, click here. 

God heard my prayers and with the help of many, we created and produced the first version of The Cross and the Light, formerly known as Living Stations, in 2002 at Our Lady of Sorrows in Farmington. To bring the story to the masses, we founded Living Faith Fine Arts Apostolate, a501c(3) Non Profit Corporation, and produced Living Stations at the Cathedral of the Most Blessed Sacrament in 2011 & 2012. Over 44,000 people have experienced this epic theatrical event. 

Remarkably, God has laid another important mission on my heart in 2012, to continue the story beyond the death of Christ by adding Act 2: The Empty Tomb to Pentecost. The union of Living Stations and the second act is now titled The Cross and the Light.

So what happens if we surpass our goal? 

Our next project is to fund a DVD of The Cross and the Light at Music Hall 2013. if we are able to raise more money on our CD campaign than is needed, we will start creating the DVD. If you'd like to be notified when our CD or DVD is ready, please click here.

Help us spread the word! 

Prayerfully consider purchasing a CD and helping us as much as you are able. We are grateful! If you are not able to purchase a CD at this time, please keep us in your prayers! You can also help us in a number of other ways.

  • Send this IndieGoGo Campaign link to every Christian you know!
  • Join us on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Check out our website at www.CrossAndLight.com.

story:
"WAITING FOR AAA" at STUDIO 501, PACE UNIVERSITY NYC

 Tickets here: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/370864

WHO ARE WE?

My name is Delaney Yeager. I'm a senior theater major at Pace University in NYC with a double minor in creative writing and fine art. Besides studying and writing, I intern for The Daily Show with Jon Stewart as well as AllThingsComedy.com. I've always known that I wanted to be a writer for TV, film, and stage.

 

I wrote Waiting for AAA after working on Samuel Beckett's Waiting for Godot, knowing I would never be able to play or cast women in any of Godot's roles. I started toying with the idea of an all-female adaptation of Godot when it soon turned into an idea that wouldn't leave me alone. What started as an idea I just jotted down in an unorganized notebook is now a 73-page play with it's own story, characters, and shape.

 

This campaign is extremely important to me as Waiting for AAA, is the first full-length play I've ever written (or directed, for that matter) and my team and I need all the support we can get so this play can be the best it can be. 

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Since the wonderful, student-run Studio 501 is a non-profit theater company, it is up to myself and the rest of the AAA ladies to fund the show, ourselves. We are asking for around $700 as I had the brilliant idea* of making a car the most necessary set piece in the show. We are currently in the creative process of figuring out how we will pull this off... we've realized it's not going to be the cheapest thing in the world.

 

It isn't only the car that is throwing us into a financial bind. Your generous contributions will help us in every department; props, costumes, lights, printing fees, etc.

 

It is not only us and our audiences who get to reap the benefits of your donations... you will, too! Please see our "Perks" to the right and find out what you can get in return for what you have given us.

 

If we do not reach our goal, the show will go on. It just will go on looking a little less baller than it would had we reached our goal.

 

*sarcasm

 

 

 

THE IMPACT

I wrote and submitted this play to Pace University's Studio 501 not only because I wanted the experience of seeing it on it's feet, but because I was hoping it would hit home with many of Pace's students. I have already found, by sharing the piece with my cast members, my crew, and my closest friends, that I was correct.

 

I wrote this piece as a 22-year-old woman just a few months from graduating. It's an exciting though bizarre and frightening place to be. I know that the themes and subjects illustrated in Waiting for AAA are ones to which just about every one of us who will be walking in our caps and gowns this summer will relate.

 

The play is also the only comedy among Studio 501's line-up this season, which I think is important! Everyone needs a good laugh - especially at the end of the semester.

 

Perhaps most importantly, Waiting for AAA gives a large handful of women the opportunity to show their theater program just how talented they are. Between the cast and crew, there are eleven very gifted, very bright women behind WFAAA, all of whom play major roles in making this a wonderful process (and a sure-to-be wonderful end product).

 

 

 

HOW TO HELP US OUT

Thank you so much for reading more about this campaign. Please check out the rest of the page, including the short moc-umentary we made of our rehearsal process. If you're feelin' generous, drop us a couple dollah bills! If you're just as broke as we all are, then just send us good vibes and help us get the word out. ANY kind of support is appreciated.

 

 

 

Thank you all so much.

 

Keep creating and keep the karma going!

 

 

 

Much love,

 

Delaney Yeager, Lizzy Bryce Caplan, Annalise Wedemeyer, Victoria Ratermanis, Elizabeth Galalis, Briana Harmon, Jaime Schwarz, Brooke Van Hensbergen, Kelsey Lake, Drew Paramore, David Armanino, & Studio 501.

 

 

 

http://pacestudio501.com/upcoming-eventsauditio...

http://pacestudio501.com/upcoming-eventsauditio...

story:
AE$OP 

Going Beyond the Fables!

The Drexel Players are back for another round of fun at the Philadelphia FringeArts Festival! This summer, we need your help to bring our latest original play AE$OP to life. 

Everyone has heard one of Aesop's fables at some point in their lives - The Tortoise and the Hare, The Dog and Its Reflection, The Boy Cried Wolf. But not everyone has taken the time to dissect, contextualize, or even plain-old understand these sometimes-twisted stories.  That's where AE$OP takes over!

AE$OP is an imaginative and immersive theatrical adaptation of the famed fables. Set in the dog-eat-dog (literally) corporate world, the tales of the fables' characters intertwine to venture beyond simple morals of right and wrong. This mature take on the stories will encourage audiences to consider what these childhood lessons truly taught us.

Who are the Drexel Players?

Good question, ambiguous potential donor! The Drexel Players are the only student-run theater organization at Drexel University. We strive to produce quality theater, engage the student body socially, and broaden students' knowledge and involvement in the Philly theater community. 

When it comes to our productions, students participate in all aspects from acting to design to publicity. Over the past two years we have staged two successful pieces for the FringeArts festival: MONUMENT in 2012 and Parts: A Speed-Through in 2013. 

This year, we will try our hands at adaptation. We will be working in conjunction with Claire Moyer, a professional director in Philadelphia, to create another spectacular production. But we can't do that without your help!


    What We Still Need

    As college students, the Drexel Players are no strangers to being thrifty (Ramen noodles, EasyMac, sneaking into dorms to do laundry on the cheap). Despite that frugal aptitude, theater can't always be bought at a 10-for-10 sale.  We try our best, like acquiring Drexel's URBN Annex Black Box for a killer performance space, but we still have some other costs to cover: 
    • Scenic Design - because our characters will be sitting in style
    • Props - because an office needs staplers, Post-its, water-coolers
    • Costume - because CEO's wear ties and blouses
    • Sound and Lighting- addressing the needs of two vital senses
    • Marketing - because people need to know when and where to show up
    • Incidentals - because laundry detergent doesn't grow on trees
    • Other - because you never know

    Get involved!

    One of the best ways you can help bring AE$OP to life is by contributing to our campaign. We have a host of amazing perks for you to take advantage of, including tickets to the show, access to behind-the-scenes videoblogs, and dinner with the cast. With Flexible Funding, we will be able to use whatever money we raise, so any contribution helps! 

    If you cannot contribute financially, feel free to share this campaign with your friends! Spread the word through Twitter, Facebook, email, or even carrier pigeon. Anything helps! If you're interested in donating creative or administrative services to the production, please email us at drexelfringe@gmail.com. THANK YOU!

    AE$OP by the Drexel Players

    Performed at the URBN Annex Black Box Theater
    3401 Filbert Street, Philadelphia, PA 19104

    September 5, 6 at 7 PM
    September 6 at 11 PM
    September 7 at 6 PM
    September 8 at 7 PM
    September 11, 12, 13 at 8 PM
    September 14 at 2 PM
